campaign.story:
UPDATE*** THE NEW Article I wrote for No Film School is up!! 😱🎥The last one generated an INSANE RESPONSE so they asked me for a sequel, haha! 🤣 In this one I Pay It Forward, as Mike Flanagan asked me to in his beautiful email to Jenny and I after he backed our Kickstarter, but rather than wait until I was more established, I decided to try help as many filmmakers as I possibly could right now! The last one had over 20k VIEWS 😱and well over 1k shares, ❤️so if this one is even close to that popular, A LOT of aspiring filmmakers are going to be happy! 🙏🎥🙏 
Click here to Read the Article!
Nothing tells our story better than this Op-Ed on No Film School! If you want to understand why and how this movie and this campaign came to be, why it's important, and why it should/will inspire indie filmmakers for a generation (with the added bonus of seeing me wear my heart on my sleeve) read my passionate Op-Ed and you'll understand completely. 
*Please share it with the aspiring filmmaker in your life! It's the key to making a feature film on virtually no-budget!
Click Here to Read the Article!
We’re beyond thrilled that our campaign got off to a record start, even attracting the attention of some Kickstarter alum who have gone on to become successful Hollywood directors, including the director of The Shining’s sequel (Doctor Sleep) and The Haunting of Hill House, Mike Flanagan. Mike even made a contribution, so our backers are already in elite company! (You can read all about the amazing circumstances in these recent news items):
CLICK HERE TO READ THE ARTICLE!
CLICK HERE TO READ THE ARTICLE!
Who is David Simpson?
He is the writer/director of Dangerous to Know, Bestselling and Award-Winning Author of the Post-Human series, Film Composer, Actor, TEDx Speaker, Technologist and Futurist.
OUR STORY:
Film Still From Dangerous to Know (2020)
Dangerous to Know isn’t only a feature-length film—it’s a multimedia experience.
That's why we're able to offer REWARDS PACKAGES that are beyond anything any Kickstarter Film Campaign has ever been able to offer. 
 Dangerous to Know is A Movie:
 Dangerous to Know is A Novel: 
DTK is Available as an Ebook, Paperback, and Audiobook as part of our Rewards Packages
Dangerous to Know is a Graphic Novel:
DTK's Graphic Novel is approx. 180 digital pages
Dangerous to Know is Music: 
DTK's Soundtrack is over 3 hours of intense cinematic music
In the film...well, you get everything you love in a movie. The gorgeous cinematography, the powerful acting performances, the thrilling music, and the full immersion of the theatrical experience.  
Film Still From Dangerous to Know (2020)
Accompanying the movie are the novel, the graphic novel, and the soundtrack.
Each one, the film, the novel versions (ebooks, paperback, audiobook), and the graphic novel are their own, unique, independent experiences. 
Film Still From Dangerous to Know (2020)
 They all portray the same, complete story, so it’s not necessary to read the novel or the graphic novel to also enjoy the film. Any one of them will suffice.
Film Still From Dangerous to Know (2020)
Rather, the unique nature of each medium demands for the story to be told in different ways so that each work of art can reach its full potential, as the tool box that a graphic novelist, a novelist, and a filmmaker use are different.
As a result, enjoying all three will deepen your experience of Dangerous to Know, as you gain access to back story that is necessary to build tension in a novel, but that would be too cumbersome to include in a film. You’ll know a character's thoughts from the graphic novel, as accessing a character’s inner monologue is a common conceit in the world of comic book storytelling, but it’s far less common in film. 
A sample page from the Dangerous to Know graphic novel, offered as one of our Rewards Packages
Explore our Rewards Page, discover the many other products on offer, including more of David Simpson's novels, personalized copies of his books, your name in the credits of the film or the acknowledgements of one of his novels, getting a character in the DTK sequel named after you, or one of our producer or Executive Producer packages...
It's a Rewards Paradise. 
Film Still From Dangerous to Know (2020)
Dangerous to Know is a fully completed (post-production included) psychological thriller feature film. Now, with the movie made, we just have one last dragon to slay, but we can’t slay this one without you. We need your help to get the movie to you, which means we need your help to fund the film’s distribution.
Film Still From Dangerous to Know (2020)
 We’re on Kickstarter to raise funds to get the film rated for distribution and to cover the cost of festival entrance fees.
Film Still From Dangerous to Know (2020)
Film Still From Dangerous to Know (2020)
We want to get Dangerous to Know to you, because we believe, once you see it in a theatre, you’ll love it as much as we do.
DTK breaks the rules.  
Film Still From Dangerous to Know (2020)
It’s a psychological thriller, it’s neo-noir, it has a femme fatale who doubles as the anti-hero, it has reversals throughout to keep your attention glued to the screen...It knows you’re programmed to think the movie is going one way, and uses that knowledge to make sure the unfolding plot is unpredictable. 
Dangerous to Know Movie Poster
It’s not like anything we’ve ever seen, and we can’t wait to share the truly unique film-watching experience with you. 
Dangerous to Know shares elements with films like The Girl With the Dragon Tattoo (either version), Inglorious Basterds, Joker, Gone Girl, I Saw The Devil, NightCrawler, Drive, and more...it’s an eclectic list, we know, but there simply isn’t a one-for-one comparison between another film and DTK.
The above films share some traits, like their intelligent, yet accessible plots—they are psychological, dark, yet beautiful and thrilling...DTK is those things too.
Film Still From Dangerous to Know (2020)
Dangerous to Know uses a psychological effect known as the Zeigarnik Effect—simply put, it’s a psychological effect that resets your attention span by giving you a new mystery for your mind to puzzle over—each time one mystery is resolved, it’s replaced by something new, and likely something you couldn’t have predicted—you’ll find yourself feeling like you’re watching a completely new movie by the midway point. Binge-watching is the result of the same effect, but we’ve never seen it done within a single movie...we think you’re going to love the feeling.
Film Still From Dangerous to Know (2020)
We can’t tell you. We can tell you the synopsis we’ve been showing to the media, but if we told you the larger story, we’d spoil the Zeigarnik Effect for you, and that would be a terrible shame. 
Film Still From Dangerous to Know (2020)
Here is something we can tell you: If you watch our nearly 4 minute trailer, you’ll barely see a frame from half of the movie’s runtime...the best, most thrilling, most visually stunning stuff in the movie can’t go into the trailer, which is a challenge when marketing DTK, but there’s no way we’re going to spoil the fun for the person we made it for: You!  
Film Still From Dangerous to Know (2020)
At any rate, here’s the synopsis we give to the media:
"Bridget is dangerous...she’s manipulative...Bridget definitely isn’t a hero...and she certainly isn’t stable...but is she a murderer? Or is it all in her mind? 
Film Still From Dangerous to Know (2020)
Get ready for a twisting—and twisted—tale that will bend your mind and keep you guessing until the last frame. From award-winning, global bestseller, David Simpson, Dangerous to Know is the first part in the first psychological thriller film-trilogy tailored for intelligent adults, but thrilling enough to be accessible to a wide, mature audience.
Film Still From Dangerous to Know (2020)
Dangerous to Know stars Bridget Graham (Pixels, Hemlock Grove, Manhattan Undying) and is written and directed by global bestselling author, David Simpson, and is based upon his novel, Dangerous to Know."
Film Still From Dangerous to Know (2020)
Stay super Involved!
We need your help to spread the word! If you film yourself buying one of the Rewards packages or Sharing our Kickstarter online, please send us the clip via YouTube link or email and we'll be thrilled to add you in a future video on either David Simpson or Bridget Graham's YouTube channel! 
You're not just part of this...YOU ARE THIS! 
We can't slay the LAST DRAGON WITHOUT YOU!  
Please SUBSCRIBE to us at youtube.com/davidsimpson and FOLLOW us on INSTAGRAM via @BridgeyOwl, @Wilsoncastaway, @Jamesanofficial, @Jenny_simps0n and @posthumanseries to stay involved. Tell other dreamers! Tell co-workers, friends, family and classmates! And of course, keep checking here for more updates! 
And, believe it or not, there’s more! Check out our rewards packages and pick the one that feels right for you and, remember, Dangerous Ones...
You’re helping us slay the last dragon 🐉 on our way to reaching our dream of seeing DTK in a theatre near you! We couldn’t do it without you!
See you at the movies!
Get in contact with us via email at: posthumanmedia@gmail.com
 Mockup Images From:
Paperback: https://www.behance.net/gallery/87268377/Free-Book-Cover-Mockup 
iPad mini: https://marieluciano.com/download/ipad-with-pen-mockup/ 
Headphone: https://www.freepik.com/free-vector/realistic-headphones-poster_1536710.html 
Ipad pro/iphone: https://www.anthonyboyd.graphics/mockups/floating-iphone-11-pro-max-and-ipad-pro-mockup/
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The challenge is to get it to theaters, but the movie is done! 
If we're successfully funded, then getting the e-products (i.e. the ebooks, digital graphic novel, audiobook, the soundtrack and the movie) won't be an issue. The graphic novel is the only one of these that will take a handful of more months to complete. 
The paperbacks will only be an issue if you live somewhere that makes delivery extremely difficult...if you're concerned about this, make sure you send us a message and we'll let you know if it looks like it's impossible or if we're good to go! (We expect the overwhelming majority of people will be reachable by delivery, and the delivery price is worked into the overall cost). 
And that's about it! We've got lots of experience selling ebooks on Amazon (that's how I made the money to fund the filming of DTK in the first place) so we're highly confident that we'll fill every pledge order before the deadline.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: POST-HUMAN DELUXE PACKAGE
support.descp: Combine all the goodness of the Special Package with everything in the DTK DELUXE PACKAGE! Get your cake, eat it too!

support.title: POST-HUMAN/DTK SUPER DELUXE PACKAGE
support.descp: You get everything in the Special Post-Human package, combined with the DTK Super Deluxe Package! This is the package for anyone who just has to get their hands on anything David makes!

support.title: ASSOCIATE PRODUCER CREDIT
support.descp: You get everything in the Post-Human/DTK Super Deluxe Package, plus you’ll share a special end credit title card with four of your fellow associate producers!

support.title: Sponsor
support.descp: Receive on-screen credit with up to 4 other sponsors on a title card, including your logo and up to 50 characters, which will include your brand name, the logo itself, and a a one sentence description of what your brand contributed. (Ex. Camera Courtesy of Blank Cameras).

support.title: ASSOCIATE PRODUCER + IMDB CREDIT
support.descp: You get everything in the Post-Human/DTK Super Deluxe Package, plus you’ll share a special end credit title card with four of your fellow associate producers! Plus IMDB Credit!

support.title: PRODUCER CREDIT & IMDB
support.descp: You get everything in the Post-Human/DTK Super Deluxe Package, plus you’ll share a special end credit title card with two of your fellow producers !

support.title: EXECUTIVE PRODUCER CREDIT & IMDB
support.descp: It goes without saying, you get everything in the Post-Human/DTK Super Deluxe Package, plus...You’re name will appear ALONE on the big screen on your very own title card! You’re an executive producer (for real!) You deserve your own title card!

support.title: Principal Sponsor
support.descp: Receive on-screen credit on your brand’s solo title card, including your logo and up to 60 characters, which will include your brand name, the logo itself, and a special “The filmmakers would like to thank Blank Company for...” introduction.

support.title: A CHARACTER NAMED AFTER YOU
support.descp: You get everything in the Post-Human/DTK Super Deluxe Package, plus your name will be used for a significant character in the DTK sequel novel, which means it’ll also be used in the sequel film (note our confidence)! No if’s here...it’s all when’s! We have one female and one male spot, and the name depends on passing our legal department review, which is a lot easier if it’s your legal name and not something like I.P. Freely.

support.title: Exclusive Sponsor
support.descp: Receive on-screen credit in a special double-duration, solo title card, including your 1.5X sized logo compared to the lower two sponsor levels, and up to 75 characters, which will include your brand name, the extra large logo, and a very special, “This film was made possible by the generous support of Blank Company for...” introduction.

campaign.story:
For design-loving minimalists, this gorgeous necklace + knife combo is the perfect EDC knife for the unpredictable lifestyle. 
First impressions when folks first check out the Knifelace®
Pocket knives are designed for just that... pockets. And yet we have found designers rarely place pockets in women's clothing. Why?  Gowns, dresses, yoga pants, athletic shorts,  leggings, and scrub pants... no pockets = no knife. And yet the pocket knife is the most used every-day-carry (EDC) tool. 
We are equipping the unpredictable lifestyle with an always-on-hand pocket knife... stored inside a stunning necklace pendant.  
 INTRODUCING THE KNIFELACE®
                           100% original design | Trademarked
A knife designed to be accessible, we have crafted the most beautiful knife-necklace  ever. The Knifelace® is a minimalist, hammered pendant that securely holds a small pocket knife.
Magnets keep the knife in place. A firm tug downward pulls the knife out of the pendent.  
PLAY

Stays safely & securely in place, yet can be deployed with just one, firm tug.
 Necklace: The knife is held in place with strong magnets.
   Fast & Easy Access: Arms full? No problem. Your knife can be accessed with one hand.
   Beautiful & Chic: Our necklace is inspired by top-rated necklace designs.
   Minimalist: Clean and simple; this pendant is designed to go with any outfit.
   High Quality: Our nickel-plated pendant has a brilliant, high-end shine.
   Effective: 1" inch hawkbill knife blade is made from 8CR13MoV stainless steel.
   Resilient: Extensively field tested, the knife is designed to last.
  Having a knife on-hand is invaluable for cutting through packing tape or opening up a blister pack. While you won't be spear fishing with the Knifelace®, our goal is to equip the strong-minded woman to be more adaptable, prepared, and ready for the unexpected.   
 Blade style: Hawkbill / Raptor Claw
 Blade material: 3CR13 stainless steel
 Blade back: Textured, anti-slip grip
 Pendant material: White silver color made from polished Nickel plated Zinc Alloy
 Pendant texture: Hammered geometric
 Eyelet: Rotated 90° allowing the pendant to lay flat
 Chain material: Stainless steel, pre-threaded / installed
 Chain length: 24 inches length, total. 20 + 4" inches / 61 + 10 CM. Extra slimming style achieved with lengthening of chain.
 Magnet strength: 0.65lbs / 10.4oz pull pressure
 Pendant weight: Just 1.2 oz (or 34g)
 Chain clasp: Lobster clasp
 Packaging: Origami-style gift presentation envelope
 Fast deployment, Sharp Knife Pendant Necklace
  "Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication."
- Leonardo da Vinci
Top rated: We drew inspiration from the highest rated pendants on the market, combining the best elements into one, clean-looking piece of art.
Geometric elements: The clean, simple lines match any outfit. There is nothing gaudy about the Knifelace®. The minimalist design compliments formal and informal wear—whether you're wearing an evening gown or yoga tights.
Textured surface: The concave dimples create a uniquely tactile surface. The hammered finish is inspired by top rated pendants. 
Adjustable 20-24" slimming chain: The chain is longer than conventional chains (24 inches / 61 cm), which naturally draws the body lengthwise. 
Multi-purpose: Be prepared and confident in who you are with a minimalist necklace for a minimalist lifestyle.  
 "Design is not just what it looks like and feels like. Design is how it works."
- Steve Jobs, Co-founder, Chairman, and CEO of Apple Inc. 
The perfect gift: Remember the rarest moments with a piece of jewelry that is just as unique.  
We're fans of simplicity: We've heard from our fans who supported our last two successful Kickstarters: "Love the simplicity of your Kickstarters."  That's why we're still committed to free shipping, world-wide, and not bogging down our fans with $1 Tweets, t-shirts, or stickers. We assume you're here for our life-changing designs, so we focus 100% on refining and providing just that. 
 This is our 3rd successful Kickstarter. We're pretty darn excited.  
The final conceptual, straight from our production headquarters. Beautiful, isn't it?
700% STRETCH GOAL REACHED!
Every Knifelace® is automatically upgraded to having a mini-pendant on the end of the chain. It compliments the upper back and back of the neck beautifully, especially when your hair is done up. 
Beautiful little mini dog tag pendant included on the back of every Knifelace®.
Behind the scenes: Tacticouture is a crew, a team, and a family. Through a wide network of incredibly creative friends and field testers, we are dedicated to fusing fashion with practicality. Below is a photo of us volunteering in Northern Nicaragua just a couple months ago. We were serving some local missionaries through our nonprofit film studio of Knok. We were also field-testing a ballistic scarf design (perhaps to be on Kickstarter if the prototypes continue as planned). We lives just south of Seattle, WA, up towards Mt Rainier--a mountain which Beau climbs annually.  Our family loves trail running, martial arts, and fluffy cats. Our entire family loves God, helping people, and going out to sushi. 
Our original Kickstarter—the Tacticlip—is now a best seller on Amazon. It's actually was sold out for several months due to the high demand. And it's all thanks to you guys, our fans. What makes us different is our Kickstarters have a tremendous amount of research put into our projects, all done before hand. We've found anticipation sets us, and our fans, up for success. We put integrity before any profit. THANK YOU for entrusting us with your support. We couldn’t improve the world without your support and backing. Thank you! 
Partners and support: TactiCouture™, Beau LLC, Chevassus Studios, Tacticlip®
 The Knifelace® stays securely in place, behind held by strong magnets. 




 Field-tested: The Knifelace® is a 90% reality. Production kinks are worked out... we're ready for our first movers and the final push to the finish line.
   One-of-a-kind: Our exclusive knife design is unlike anything your friends have ever seen. We've heard it already: "I love your pendent." "Thanks, it's a knife." "Wait what?"
   Practice what we preach: We use the very products we produce, *nearly everyday (*some days we fly through TSA, and naturally we comply with safety requirements)
   Commitment to quality: When faced with a decision to cut a tiny bit of cost or deliver a higher quality product, we go with the latter. We want quality products, and we assume everyone else wants the same thing.
   Fans first: Ask any of our previous backers and you'll find we put our fans first. We serve our backers before we serve ourselves.
   Gorgeous gifts: Be that brilliant person who's ahead of birthdays, Christmas, and your anniversary. We love to set gift-givers up for success.
   Free shipping: Worldwide. All levels. Yes, you read that right.
   Be the first: We are early adopters at heart; we get a rush out of being the first to experience a proven design. 
Perfect gift - We have designed beautiful origami style packaging to accompany a beautifully designed necklace
Budget note: Kickstarter's project budget feature is new, and it doesn't take into account previously raised capital from previous Kickstarters (e.g. the Tacticlip black and camouflage versions). This Kickstarter is the final push towards raising all we can to produce Knifelaces®. Join us!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
MANUFACTURING: As with our previous campaign, we factor as much manufacturer error in as possible. We have tested (and re-tested) our necklace production process to ensure delivery on time at the high quality standards you expect. That said there is always a gamble in the manufacturing world. We thank all of our amazing fans for backing our previous Kickstarters. We hope this tool brings you much joy and use. 

HEALTH: This is a tool. Use with caution. There are magnets on this necklace. If you are adversely affected by magnets (e.g. Pacemaker), please consult a health professional prior to using. Use at your own risk. There are small parts; keep out of reach of children. Choking, cutting, and strangulation hazard. This tool is sharp and can break or the blade can be dislodged. This tool is not intended for self defense, 'survival,' or strenuous use. Tacticouture, Tacticlip, Beau LLC, Beau Chevassus, the creators and/or fans of this project bear no liability or responsibility due to the use or misuse of this tool. By backing this project, you assume full responsibility of the use and/or misuse of this tool. Be an adult, know your local laws and comply accordingly. 

TIMELINE: We are pleased to have a history of very successful Kickstarters, however we have found there are always curveballs when it comes to new designs. We do our best to project realistic timelines and be 100% transparent with our backers (just look at our past Kickstarters). However timelines often have to be adjusted. If so, we will communicate when and why. Still we build in failsafes and extra time so we can "under promise and over deliver." Our goal is to delight our amazing fans, and your support and easy-going understanding means the world as we peer into the crystal ball and predict the future. 

BOTTOM LINE: We are human. While we do our best, we can fail. This is reality. (*pause for existential crises*) However rest assured we put you and God first... not ourselves. (see Mark 12:30-31) Feel free to check out our past Kickstarters to see how we place others first. Any questions, email us; our turnaround time to respond is less than 24 hours when we're in-country.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
We have one simple mission - to make playing the guitar and composing music more fun and more accessible to all.
The Really Useful Guitar Poster
Overview
The Really Useful Guitar Poster displays 4 separate scales, 60 individual chords and a wealth of music theory, all on one easy-to-read poster. A great gift for aspiring guitar players and a best friend to songwriters, the poster comes in a range of formats that look great on any wall.
Scales
Never forget your scales again...or learn them if you never knew them! 4 of the most common scales (Major, Natural Minor, Major Blues & Minor Blues) clearly illustrated for ease of reading and memorisation.
Chords
Play me an F# minor chord. No? Me neither. 5 of the most common chords (Major, Minor, Major 7, Minor 7 & Dominant 7) in all key signatures, clearly annotated so you’ll never be stumped again.
Theory
Diagrams and tables that help you familiarise yourself with a guitar, form chords, write chord progressions, identify relative keys and learn the relationship between different key signatures. All handy references to help you create music.
Design
The poster was meticulously designed with beginners in mind, so that anyone can pick up a guitar and start playing. Even if you’ve never picked up a guitar before, the combination of illustrations and descriptions will guide you through. Not to mention we think it looks great on a wall!
Print
Our posters are printed in the UK and the USA, using FSC compliant paper and environmentally friendly inks. The result is a beautiful quality print that you’ll be proud to hang on your wall.
Formats
The poster is available in a range of formats to suit different budgets and applications. We’ve got you (and your wall) covered.
Digital
       Downloadable, printable PDF version of the poster. Sent out immediately after the campaign is over.
Folded (FREE SHIPPING)
       A1 size poster. Printed on 170gsm gloss paper. Folded down to A4 for easy shipping. Comes with FREE Shipping Worldwide & FREE Digital Version.
Rolled
       A1 size poster. Printed on 250gsm gloss paper. Comes rolled in a cardboard tube. This means there are no creases in your poster, but shipping costs extra. Comes with a FREE Digital Version.
Funding & Rewards
Funding
We've developed the product, designed the brand, built the website and produced the video. Now, all we need is the money to fund our first print-run, so we can get The Really Useful Guitar Poster off the ground and into the hands of those who want it.
Rewards
We are offering ‘Digital’, ‘Folded’, ‘Rolled’ and ‘Bundled’ versions of the poster as rewards.
Download links to the Digital version of the poster will be sent out as soon as you have given us your email address (by filling in your Backer Survey).
Assuming you complete your Backer Survey in time, we will ship your physical poster within 2 weeks of the campaign ending.
Conclusion
This poster was designed out of a genuine need to bring several learning resources together onto one easily-accessible format. We are really happy with the result and genuinely believe it will help many people learn to play and compose music more easily. We love that thought, we love this poster and we love our business. We hope you do too. 
Packaging
Depending on which version of the poster you buy, it will be shipped in different packaging.
Folded - These A1 posters are folded down to A4 size (the same size as a sheet of office paper) and placed inside a mailing envelope. This means the overall package is very small and light, and therefore much cheaper to ship than the ‘Rolled’ version (which is how we can offer FREE SHIPPING WORLDWIDE).
Rolled - This version is the same size as the Folded version (A1), but it comes rolled rather than folded (meaning they arrive with you crease-free). They are shipped inside an A1-sized cardboard mailing-tube, which means they are more expensive to ship than the ‘Folded’ version (which is why we charge extra for shipping).
Carriers & Transit Times
All versions (apart from ‘Folded’ posters shipping to the UK) are sent via tracked and signed services, meaning you'll receive a tracking number for your order once it has been dispatched, and you'll be required to sign for the package once it reaches you.
UK
Folded
       Service: Royal Mail 1st Class
       Average transit time: 1-2 working days
Rolled
       Service: Royal Mail Special Delivery
       Average transit time: 1-2 working days
Europe
Folded
       Service: Royal Mail International Tracked & Signed
       Average transit time: 7-10 working days
Rolled
       Service: Royal Mail International Tracked & Signed
       Average transit time: 7-10 working days
United States & Canada
Folded
       Service: Royal Mail International Tracked & Signed
       Average transit time: 7-10 working days
Rolled
       Service: Royal Mail International Tracked & Signed
       Average transit time: 7-10 working days
Rest of the World (ROW)
Folded
       Service: Royal Mail International Tracked & Signed
       Average transit time: 10-12 working days
Rolled
       Service: Royal Mail International Tracked & Signed
       Average transit time: 10-12 working days
Cost
UK
Folded - FREE
       Rolled - £8
Europe
Folded - FREE
       Rolled - £11
United States & Canada
Folded - FREE
       Rolled - £15
Rest of the World (ROW)
Folded - FREE
       Rolled - £15

campaign.story:
Hi Kickstarter, I'm Dave and I make awesome food. Study of Sweets is something that I really love. The amount of joy my chocolate brings to people is something that cannot be replicated in any other way. I opened my retail store about 2 years ago in Hillsboro, Oregon. After a lot of hard work and a lot of challenges,  we are ready to bring our sweetness to the rest of the country. I truly believe that the quality, variety and prices are unmatched and we can build something really great. 
Over 200 unique chocolate bars, 50+ Vegan options,  100+ Gluten Free options. All our chocolate is ethically sourced with 10% of profits going to the Fairtrade Cocoa program. Build your own gift box and eat sweetly! 
Each bar is at least 2oz and most are very close to 3oz. For the quality you will not find a better deal. 
 I will send a survey, so you will be able to choose your bars, when the campaign ends!
 The box (mock up, design is ready to go):
All of our products are hand made using only the finest quality and ethically sourced ingredients. 10% of all of our profits (from the business, not the Kickstarter campaign) will go to the the Fairtrade Cocoa Program,  who work to insure good conditions for cocoa farmers around the world. We will post our donations on social media, on our website and through our newsletter. 
Our partners:
The rewards:
We are launching our website with over 200 types of chocolate bars that you can use to build a custom gift box. We will also have an amazing variety of dipped pretzels and dipped dried fruits.  The quality of the ingredients and the flavor profiles will bring a smile to anyone's mouth. 
You can see most of our flavors in the graphic below or check out studyofsweets.com/collections/bars to see pictures of all the bars (no online ordering yet).  
We are on Kickstarter to find you, yes you, and bring this sweet dream to life. We need to raise funds for a large run of custom gift boxes as well as larger chocolate tempering machines and supplies to ship chocolate year round. 
The dollars and cents:
Back the project, share on social media with a chocolate lover and comment here for any questions or feedback. Thanks for getting involved!
Follow us on Social Media
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are not many risks involved. I am ready to (and already doing so) produce a ton of chocolate bars. 

If we blow way past our goals there will be some timing challenges but we will execute as quick as we can and keep everyone informed. All rewards should be delivered by the end of October if not sooner. 

We may not get the custom designed boxes done in time for the rewards depending on the lead times when I order. We will definitely have the white gift boxes ready.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.descp: Work with me to create the bar of your dreams and get 333 of them. We can mix it up among white milk or dark or create one than one flavor. You can also choose from any other flavors. Divided into gift boxes, shipped in one delivery. Shipping included.

support.title: Chocolate / Foodie Trip for 4 people
support.descp:
Airfare and personal spending money (gifts and such) not included. Everything else is.
4 people
Spend 2 days and nights in foodie heaven with (or just guided by) Dave.
2-4 rooms in a hotel in Portland or Hillsboro, Oregon (your choice of city).
Day 1 - spend the day learning about and making chocolate, a tasting of Hillsboro for lunch and dinner at one of Dave's favorite restaurant (I'll give you some options).
Day 2 - A food tour of Portland. I will show you the sights and tastes of Portland.
Lots of Chocolate to take home.

support.title: EARLY BIRD 5 Chocolate Bars in a Box
support.descp: 6 Chocolate Bars of your choice, in Gift Box. Shipping Included.

updates.update_content:
Hi All,
Most of you have gotten your bars and we have received nothing but really positive feedback. High five!
There are still a large handful of backers who we do not have their selections. I will be reaching out to all individually by early next week.

Hi all, Sorry it's been a bit long since last update. We are about 25-30% done. Over the next 2 weeks we will have the majority of rewards delivered. 
Join us on Facebook for lots of pictures and fun. 
More news coming soon.

Hi all, 
We have been busy making chocolate and getting everything ready to begin fulfilling rewards. 
We will do our best to ship in order of your backer number. We will also be shipping chocolate only early in the week as to not have long times for delivery. So over the next month the majority of backers will get their rewards. If you have a low backer number expect your rewards in the next week or two.

Surveys and rewards are still coming . As you can imagine it is a lot of information to organize and plan so please be patient.  
 This week I will be going through them all individually as we begin making and fulfilling.  I will reach out individually if I have any issues or questions about your choices.

Hi all,
Thanks to everyone who sent surveys back .  
I will be double checking everything this weekend and will reach out individually if there are any issues. 
1. Address here on kickstarter.

Over 4,500 chocolate bars among 259 backers!!!! That is a lot of chocolate. 
All reward surveys are in your email boxes.
Any questions or issues let me know. 
Update soon at least once a week.

HI All,
I want to make sure I keep everyone in the loop every step of the way. 
I am going to take one more day to make sure surveys are accurate and I am organized for them to come in.  
One new machine shipped today and I am super excited.

Chocolate machine ordered! New toys, i mean equipment, are always fun. 
Small hiccup with the survey, I'm working on it and will have it out on Monday. Check your emails that you used on kickstarter. 
I'm easily reachable at eat@studyofsweets.com or reach out on facebook.  https://www.facebook.com/StudyOfSweets/

Business , like life, is phases. The funding part of our kickstarter is over. It was close but we are now ready to come out swinging. 
Over the next few days you will review an email with a form to full out for your rewards. Reach out to me if you do not get it.  
Please get these back to me as soon as possible so we can plan and start fulfilling all your rewards.

campaign.story:
Hello, everyone!
My name is Hans Fex. I've spent much of my life traveling the world to collect rare and fascinating objects. Over the years, and with the help of so many wonderful people, I've assembled an incredible collection which I am sharing with the world through a project called Mini Museum!
Examining a Burmese amber sample after hours in the markets of Téngchōng, China
The Mini Museum is a personal collection of curiosities where every item is authentic, iconic, and labeled. It's carefully designed to take you on a journey of learning and exploration.
Mini Museum Age of Dinosaurs - Small (13-Specimens) and Large (32-Specimens)
Encased in the highest quality Lucite acrylic, the Mini Museum will last for generations. It is a truly awesome collection that makes a wonderful gift for the person who has just about everything, or for someone special you want to inspire.  
Four Unique Collections for Tens of Thousands of Backers Around the World! ❤️
Since our first Kickstarter project back in 2014, we've shared this journey across space and time with tens of thousands of people all over the world through four unique collections.
This time we've come back to share our first subject-focused collection: Mini Museum Age of Dinosaurs! 
Mini Museum Age of Dinosaurs - Large (32-Specimens)
Age of Dinosaurs is a breathtaking collection paced across one hundred and eighty-five million years! There are 35 specimens in Age of Dinosaurs, making it our largest collection since the First Edition!
Beginning with the near extinction of all life on Earth, we’ll witness the struggle to rebound even as the surface of the planet tears itself apart.
Adorned with feathers and scales, species will radiate and blossom in unparalleled variety, and by tooth and claw... life will find a way.
You will hold the largest creatures to ever walk the Earth and the most powerful predators of all time. Then, when we’ve reached the end, we'll watch as life once more succumbs to a fiery cataclysm!
Specimens from Age of Dinosaurs - More Details Below!
Below you'll find a chart of all the specimens in the collection and the versions in which they appear:  
Age of Dinosaurs Specimen List
As with past Editions, the Large and the Small will arrive in a handsome Display Box, protected by a Custom Microfiber Pouch. 
Packaging Elements from the Age of Dinosaurs Display Box
Each Mini Museum also comes with a Certificate of Authenticity and a 160-page, hardbound book we call the Companion Guide. The Companion Guide is a starting point for learning more about the specimens in the collection, details about our process, and additional references so that you can continue exploring on your own!
Raptor Storytime with the Companion Guide! (Raptor Cameo Credit: Atrociraptor marshalli from David Silva's Beasts of the Mesozoic Collection)
Giving back to our backers who make each edition of the Mini Museum possible!
During this campaign, we're offering the opportunity to back all three versions of Age of Dinosaurs (Large, Small, and Touch) with special pricing for every tier!
Since we're talking about dinosaurs it seemed really appropriate to name the tiers after the three geological periods of the Mesozoic:
 Triassic  (Early Bird I):
Large $259
Touch $259
Small $99
Jurassic  (Early Bird II):
Large $269
Touch $269
Small $109
Cretaceous (Early Bird III):
Large $279
Touch $279
Small $119
After the campaign, the prices will return to our standard $299 for the Large and the Touch, and the Small will be $129. 
Mini Museum Age of Dinosaurs - Small (13-Specimens)
Once more, we are offering $10 worldwide shipping, so no matter where you are, shipping will cost just $10 for your Kickstarter reward!
Please Note: Shipping prices only apply to your Kickstarter rewards. Any add-ons purchased after the campaign will have standard shipping rates applied in line with past campaigns.
Important Information for Backers Outside the United States: As with past projects, the shipping price for your Kickstarter reward only includes the cost of shipping and insurance. The price does not include sales tax/VAT or any duties/customs fees that may apply.
Individual numbers will be exclusive to the Kickstarter version of the Touch and Large.
Each Mini Museum is unique, but this time around we're going to make the Large and Touch a bit more special for our Kickstarter backers by limiting the laser-etched, individually numbered Large and hand-numbered Touch Mini Museums to backers of the campaign.
After we finish the batches for our Kickstarter backers, all future Large and Touch Mini Museums will have "LIMITED EDITION" printed inside just as we do with the Small.
Mini Museum Age of Dinosaurs - Large (32-Specimens)
The Kickstarter version of the Touch will feature ALL 35 specimens in the Age of Dinosaurs Collection.
The Touch is a special version of the Mini Museum where all of the specimens are accessible for careful study.  When building the Age of Dinosaurs Touch, we noticed that we could fill all of the slots this time around so that's exactly what we decided to do!
All 35 Specimens from Age of Dinosaurs in the Touch!
Kickstarter Backers of the Touch will receive all 35 specimens from the Age of Dinosaurs collection in addition to receiving an individually numbered Certificate of Authenticity. After the campaign, the Touch will feature the same 32 specimens as the Large and will not have an individual number.
Did you know we send Mini Museums and other items to schools around the world? We do and you can help!
We also have a new t-shirt design to support our Educational Donation Program!
Get a sweet dinosaur t-shirt and help us send Mini Museums to kids around the world!
The shirt design features a custom illustration with specimens from the Age of Dinosaurs collection on a black t-shirt. Backers of other tiers will also have the opportunity to add shirts after the campaign.
All funds gathered from the t-shirt will be applied to our Educational Donation Program which sends Mini Museums and other specimens to organizations that work with children all over the world. Your support really helps!
Thank you for taking the time to learn more about Age of Dinosaurs!
I hope you are as excited about it as we are! As always, we are grateful for the opportunity to share such incredible specimens and their stories with the world. Your kindness and enthusiasm is so inspiring! 
- Hans Fex, Creator and Chief Curator of the Mini Museum
Brief details about each specimen in the collection can be found below, with even more information available on minimuseum.com!
THE GREAT DYING - c. 252,280,000 YEARS OLD
"Life has often been disturbed on this earth by frightful events." ~ Georges Cuvier, Discours sur les révolutions de la surface du globe (1822)
The Permian-Triassic Extinction Event is the largest extinction event in the history of the planet. The chief catalyst of this extinction event is a series of massive volcanic eruptions known as the Siberian Traps. Over the course of 1,000,000 years, these flood basalt eruptions covered over 7 million square kilometers (2,700,000 square miles). [READ MORE]
TETHYS OCEAN - HIMALAYAN SHALIGRAM
"The folded and crumpled deposits of this ocean stand forth to heaven in Tibet, Himalaya, and the Alps." ~ Eduard Suess, Austrian Geologist, "Are Great Ocean Depths Permanent" (1893)
At the beginning of the Mesozoic Era, the Tethys Ocean was bound by the great Panthalassa Ocean within the cradle of the supercontinent Pangaea. During the Jurassic Period, the shifting continents compressed the Tethys to form an equatorial seaway stretching from today's Caribbean Islands to what is now the Himalayas. [READ MORE]
THE BREAKUP OF PANGAEA - c. 200,000,000 YEARS OLD
"Our planet is a restless home." ~ Sean C. Solomon, Chair NASA Solid Earth Science Working Group
Pangaea existed as a single landmass for approximately 160,000,000 years. The breakup came after a series of powerful rifting events, in which strong pulses of magma forced continental plates apart at the seams, creating new crust and opening up the basin in which the Atlantic Ocean eventually took shape. [READ MORE]
GONDWANA - ARAUCARIA TREE
"Imagine an observer approaching our planet from outer space, and pushing aside the belts of clouds which obscure our atmosphere to simply gaze for a whole day on the surface as it rotates beneath them... The features beyond all others most likely to arrest their attention would be the wedge-like outlines of the continents as they narrow away to the South. This is indeed the most striking character present on the map of our world, and it has been so ever since the chief features of our planet have become known to us." ~ Edward Suess, Austrian Geologist and the first to advance the theory of the Gondwana supercontinent in "The Face of the Earth" (1885)
Gondwana comprised the southern portion of Pangaea. As Pangaea began to break apart, so too did Gondwana, with the present-day continents of Africa, South America, India, Antarctica, and Australia slowly moving in different directions. [READ MORE]
LAURASIA -  AMMOLITE GEM
"Three times during their reign of more than 300 million years, ammonites experimented with the most bizarre and startling shell shapes." ~ Wolfgang Grulke, author of "Heteromorph: The Rarest Fossil Ammonites"
Laurasia, like its southern counterpart Gondwana, was part of Pangaea until driven apart by the rifting of the Central Atlantic Magmatic Province. This event also created the basin for today's Northern Atlantic Ocean. [READ MORE]
DINOSAUR EGG - HYPSELOSAURUS
"I would go to museums and say can I open your dinosaur egg? Can I just drop them on the floor and look inside? And they'd say no." ~ Jack Horner, Paleontologist
When thinking about deep time, we often find ourselves caught up in the nearly unfathomable expanses of millennia stretched end to end. Yet, here in this humble eggshell, we have a single moment captured for all eternity… the birth of an individual dinosaur. [READ MORE]
DINOSAUR FOOTPRINT - GRALLATOR
"So strikingly did these tracks resemble those of birds, that they were familiarly spoken of as the tracks of 'poultry,' or of 'Noah's Raven.'" ~ Edward Hitchock, "Ichnology of New England" (1858)
Imagine for a moment that you are standing along a muddy flat shoreline, looking out towards the horizon. The half-light of dawn is just within reach. You are alone here on this shore, but not for long. You hear the soft, wet sounds of feet slapping in the mud. The pace is steady but unhurried. You look through the shadows and there on two legs is a dinosaur! [READ MORE]
DINOSAUR SKIN - HADROSAUR
"Most of what is known about dinosaur skin comes from several exceptionally preserved hadrosaurid fossils." ~ Matt Davis, Department of Geology and Geophysics, Yale University
When we think of dinosaur fossils we usually imagine bones and teeth, but fossilized skin and scale impressions have also been discovered, as well as the imprints of feathers. [READ MORE]
DINOSAUR FOOD - CYCAD
"Tell me what you eat and I will tell you what you are." ~ Anthelme Brillat-Savarin, Méditations de Gastronomie Transcendante (1826)
The palm-like figure of the Cycad is familiar to fans of classic, paleoart paintings. The extensive presence of these gymnosperms in the fossil record presents a complex picture of this long-lived family of seed-bearing plants and their relationship with the largest creatures to ever walk the Earth. [READ MORE]
DINOSAUR DUNG - COPROLITE
"The Mesozoic trend to sauropod gigantism led to the evolution of immense microbial vats unequalled in modern land animals." ~ David M.Wilkinson, University of Lincoln
Scientifically speaking, coprolites are fossilized poop. Over millions of years, minerals, such as chalcedony and quartz, replaced the original organic material. This process creates a rich, colorful matrix which allows us to study the diet and lifestyle of long-extinct creatures. [READ MORE]

PLESIOSAUR - PADDLE
"Like a sea serpent run through a turtle." ~ William Buckland, Oxford University Geology Lectures, 1832
Plesiosaurs were incredibly successful creatures. Featuring a long, snake-like neck and a stout body equipped with slender paddles, Plesiosaurs are one of the most readily identifiable of all ancient marine reptiles. [READ MORE]
PLIOSAUR - BONE
"Pliosaurs were generalist predators at the top of the food chain, able to prey on reptiles and fishes up to half their own length." ~ Dr. Davide Foffa, Vertebrate Paleontologist
Pliosaurs had short necks and large heads with powerful jaws. With some species reaching lengths of 10m (30ft) or more, these apex predators dominated the oceans of their day, hunting a variety of prey including fellow marine reptiles. [READ MORE]

ICHTHYOSAUR - VERTEBRA
"I by no means consider it wholly a fish, when compared to other fishes, but rather view it in a similar light to those animals met with in New South Wales." ~ Sir Everard Home, Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society of London (June 23, 1814)
Ichthyosaurs were marine reptiles with streamlined bodies. They were air-breathing creatures with two nostrils situated far back on the top of the head, similar in shape to a modern porpoise. Ichthyosaurs likely fed on fish using their numerous sharp teeth and enormous eyes to locate prey in deep water. [READ MORE]
MOSASAUR - TOOTH
"The Mosasaur used surprise and the thrust of his muscular tail to outrun his prey with a short burst of speed." ~ Michael J. Everhart, Oceans of Kansas
Mosasaurs were among the last of the great Mesozoic marine reptile lines. Their skulls were flexible and their jaws double-hinged. While this arrangement allowed a Mosasaur to swallow prey whole, the alignment of a Mosasaur's teeth with "bony crypts" to protect emerging teeth also suggests Mosasaurs likely crushed bones and shells as frequently as they tore into flesh. [READ MORE]
BRACHIOSAURUS - FEMUR
"This then was the giraffe among dinosaurs..." ~ Elmer Riggs (1903)
Best known for their powerful silhouette, Brachiosaurus roamed western North America during the Late Jurassic. Their long necks reached upwards of 9m (30ft), sloping sharply towards muscular shoulders. [READ MORE]
DIPLODOCUS - ANKLE
"It is pleasing to think that the first residents of Earth to exceed the sound barrier were not humans, but rather diplodocus sauropods." ~ Nathan Myhrvold "Supersonic sauropods? Tail dynamics in the diplodocids."
With a whip-like tail, Diplodocus was one of the longest dinosaurs, stretching  33m (110ft) from head to tail. Balancing 10-16 metric tons across such a long frame required strong legs with semi-fixed ankles and toes. [READ MORE]
CRETACEOUS AMBER - WITH INSECT (L) and ROUGH (S) 
"A window to a unique, highly diverse Mesozoic microbiota worthy of intense exploration." ~ Dr. David A. Grimaldi, Curator, "Fossiliferous Cretaceous Amber from Myanmar (Burma): Its Rediscovery, Biotic Diversity, and Paleontological Significance"
Age of Dinosaurs contains two different amber specimens from the Late Cretaceous Period. The Large features a small, polished bead of amber from the Hukawng Valley of Northern Myanmar (Burma) which also includes a small arthropod (insect, arachnid, etc). The Small version contains a fragment of rough amber from the ancient coastal deposits of the Black Creek Formation (North Carolina, USA). [READ MORE]
ATLASAURUS - BONE
"The description of new genera and new species of dinosaurs discovered recently in North Africa completely changed the vision we had." ~ Dr. Philippe Taquet, "The Dinosaurs of Maghreb: the History of their Discovery"
Discovered high in the Atlas Mountains of Morocco, Atlasaurus was a specialized sauropod genus from the mid-Jurassic. Estimated at about 50ft (15m) long and weighing 15 tons, this sauropod had extremely long limbs paired with a relatively short neck. [READ MORE]
APATOSAURUS - BONE 
"I saw eight of the tail bones in exact position. It was a beautiful sight." ~ Earl Douglass (August 17, 1909)
Apatosaurus is one of the best-known of all sauropods. In the public mind, this popularity is due to early confusion that led to the skulls of other sauropods being mounted on their skeletons under the name of Brontosaurus. [READ MORE]
IGUANODON - BONE 
"There was a period when the earth was peopled by oviparous quadrupeds of a most appalling magnitude." ~ Dr. Gideon Mantell, "The Geological Age of Reptiles" (1831)
Iguanodons were prolific herbivores spanning the Late Jurassic and Early Cretaceous Periods. These dinosaurs had a horny beak whose superficial resemblance resulted in their name ("iguana tooth"). [READ MORE]
STEGOSAURUS - PLATE
"A five-ton ballet dancer with an armor-plated tutu of flipping bony triangles and a swinging war club." ~ Robert T. Bakker, The Dinosaur Heresies
The plates and spikes of Stegosaurus are called osteoderms, bony deposits that form in the skin rather than growing as extensions of the skeleton. Lacking an anchor to the skeleton, some scientists believe that Stegosaurus's plates would provide limited mechanical protection. [READ MORE]
TRICERATOPS -  BROW HORN
"The horns also had a real role in physical combat." ~ Andrew A. Farke, Raymond M. Alf Museum of Paleontology "Evidence of Combat in Triceratops"
Triceratops measured 29ft (9m) long and 10ft (3m) tall, with the head comprising nearly one-third the overall length. Studies of the incidence of lesions in the cranium and frill suggest that the Triceratops used its horns in combat and the frill was an adaptation for protection. [READ MORE]
ANKYLOSAURUS - ARMOR
"The armor are bones that form within the skin, just like crocodiles." ~ Ken Carpenter, Director USU Eastern Prehistoric Museum
Covered in rows of bony plates and wielding a powerful clubbed tail, the Ankylosaurs are one of the most distinctive and successful of all dinosaur families. Various species of this sturdy dinosaur can be found on every continent on earth. [READ MORE]

PACHYCEPHALOSAURUS -  DOME
"The domes could withstand considerable impact force at certain closing speeds." ~ Eric Snively and Andrew Cox "Structural mechanics of pachycephalosaur crania permitted head-butting behavior."
Instantly recognizable by their massive frontoparietal domes, Pachycephalosaurs were a group of bipedal dinosaurs that roamed the Late Cretaceous Period. [READ MORE]
HADROSAUR - BONE
"Hadrosaurs grew rapidly, and quantifying their growth is key to understanding life-history interactions between predators and prey during the Late Cretaceous." ~ Lisa Noelle Cooper, "Relative growth rates of predator and prey dinosaurs reflect effects of predation."
Hadrosaurs were a large family of ornithischian dinosaurs from the Cretaceous Period. Related to Iguanodons, they are known primarily for their "duck-bills" which are in fact elongated rostral bone structures which give the appearance of a beak. [READ MORE]
PTEROSAUR - WING BONE
"One of these strange animals, whose appearance would be frightful did they occur alive at the present day, may have been of the size of a thrush." ~ Georges Cuvier Théorie de la terre (1821)
Spanning more than 160 million years across the fossil record, Pterosaurs were a diverse group of flying reptiles that dominated the skies of the Mesozoic Era. [READ MORE]
ALLOSAURUS - VERTEBRA 
"This genus may be distinguished from any known Dinosaurs by the vertebrae, which are peculiarly modified to ensure lightness." ~ Othniel Charles Marsh (1877)
Allosaurus was one of the most dominant predators of the Late Jurassic Period. This large theropod is known for its powerful, three-fingered forelimbs, wide gape, and iconic "hornlets" over the eyes. [READ MORE]
SPINOSAURUS - SPINE  (L) and TOOTH (S) 
"Spinosaurus appears to have been poorly adapted to bipedal terrestrial locomotion." ~ Dr. Nizar Ibrahim, "Semiaquatic Adaptations in a Giant Predatory Dinosaur."
Topping out at just over 59ft long (18m), Spinosaurus is one of the largest carnivorous dinosaurs ever discovered. Age of Dinosaurs contains two different Spinosaurus specimens. The Large features a fragment of a Spinosaurus vertebra which includes the neural spines. The Small includes a fragment of a Spinosaurus tooth. [READ MORE]
RAPTOR - DROMAEOSAURID BONE
"You bred raptors?" ~ Dr. Alan Grant, Jurassic Park
Known popularly as "raptors," dromaeosaurids were a diverse family of feathered theropod dinosaurs. Like birds, dromaeosaurids had a global distribution and varied widely in size, from smaller than a modern-day chicken to large, powerful predators measuring more than 18ft (6m) in length from tooth-to-tail. [READ MORE]
TYRANNOSAURUS REX - TOOTH (L) and VERTEBRA (S)
"We need to start thinking of dinosaurs as not just brutes and not just monsters, and not just things with sharp teeth and sharp claws, but as really active, intelligent, energetic animals." ~ Dr. Steve Brusatte (2018)
Measuring 40ft (12m) in length and weighing upwards of 14 tons, Tyrannosaurus rex was one of the largest and most powerful terrestrial predators in history. Age of Dinosaurs contains two different T. rex specimens. The Large features a fragment of a T. rex tooth, and the Small version contains a fragment of a T. rex vertebra. [READ MORE]
DEATH OF THE DINOSAURS - DECCAN TRAPS and K-PG BOUNDARY
"The species extinctions prior to the generally assumed impact event implied by the Ir anomaly, and the long recovery period of the ecosystem thereafter cannot be explained by a single impact, but suggest that multiple causes may be responsible such as climatic changes, volcanism, a sea level drop, production of warm saline bottom water and the chemical consequences associated with increased salinity." ~ Dr. Gerta Keller, Princeton University (1988)
"Impact of a large earth-crossing asteroid would inject about 60 times the object's mass into the atmosphere as pulverized rock; a fraction of this dust would stay in the stratosphere for several years and be distributed worldwide. The resulting darkness would suppress photosynthesis, and the expected biological consequences match quite closely the extinctions observed in the paleontological record." ~ Dr. Luis Alvarez and Dr. Walter Alvarez (1980)
The large-scale geological event known as the End-Cretaceous Mass Extinction had a profound influence on life on our planet. Three-quarters of all life perished in a geological instant, including all non-avian dinosaur species.
We mark the end of the Mesozoic Era with the physical evidence behind the two leading theories for the death of the dinosaurs: the flood basalts of the Indian Subcontinent known as the Deccan Traps and the K-Pg Boundary from the Chicxulub Asteroid Impact. [READ MORE]
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Since 2014, we've delivered tens of thousands of Mini Museums to more than 100 countries around the world, so we have a good handle on the risks associated with the project. Still, creating a Mini Museum is an extremely complex process.

Each specimen in the Mini Museum has its own unique challenges, and the scale of the project may lead to unexpected delays. We've taken every step possible to mitigate potential issues while always keeping the focus on the quality of the end product. As with past projects, we plan to provide detailed and timely project updates to keep backers advised, informed, educated, and at times entertained.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello, everyone!
We hope this message finds you safe and healthy! If you're following us on social media or are subscribed to our newsletter list, you know that we've been keeping busy even while we are working separately from one another.

updates.update_userinfo: Production and Shipping Update: Need to redirect or pause your shipment? Plus "T" is for Triceratops
updates.update_content:
Hi, everyone!
A quick message from the Mini Museum team.
It's hard to watch the news and see the impact of COVID-19 and not think about all of you. We hope this message finds you and your families healthy and safe. ❤️

updates.update_userinfo: Age of Dinosaurs Begins to Arrive! 🚚🦖Production & Shipping Update, Top Shipping Questions, and Backer Pictures 📸
updates.update_content:
Hello, everyone!
If you're following us on social media, you know that Age of Dinosaurs has started to arrive around the world! 🚚🦖

updates.update_userinfo: Production Update: Shipping Begins! 🎉 Age of Dinosaurs Digital Companion Guide Released! 📚ROAR with Backer Kevin Canali! 🦖❤️
updates.update_content:
Hello, everyone!
We're excited to report that the Display Boxes and Companion Guides arrived in the warehouse a few days early. They passed inspection, and so it's time to begin shipping! 🎉

updates.update_userinfo: Surveys Locked Down, Charging for Add-Ons in 48 hours, Production Update
updates.update_content:
Hi, everyone!
A quick message here from the Mini Museum team!
Those of you who have completed your surveys should receive a "48-hour final notice" lockdown email message shortly. This is your opportunity to make any changes to your address or modify add-ons. Once the 48-hours have passed, the system will finalize the lockdown and begin charging for all add-ons.

updates.update_userinfo: Happy New Year! 🎉Production Update, the Great Dying, and the Ringing Birth of a New Volcano 🌋
updates.update_content:
Happy New Year, everyone! 🎉
It was a busy holiday season for us here in Northern Virginia and we're excited to keep things moving in 2020! To begin, I'm happy to report that all aspects of Age of Dinosaurs production are on schedule!
The first batch of Large Mini Museums is nearly complete. We've already received a handful of production units here at MMHQ for review and they are beautiful!

Hello, everyone!
Thank you so very much for your incredible response to the BackerKit surveys! We're already at 60% complete!
A few backers reported having issues with Illuminated LED Stands to their orders. We've resolved that problem, so if you tried to add a stand and could not, you should be able to now.

Hello, everyone!
I'm excited to announce that the BackerKit surveys have gone out the door! You should receive your survey link by email in the next few minutes, so keep an eye on your Inbox and your Junk mail folder (just in case).
Frequently Asked Questions

Hello, everyone!
This update includes details about BackerKit surveys and all of the add-ons we're offering for Age of Dinosaurs. There's a lot to take in so please read carefully. Don't hesitate to drop us an email at service@minimuseum.com if something is unclear!
BackerKit Surveys Launch MONDAY, December 9th at 4PM ET (GMT-5)

updates.update_userinfo: Production Update, Fifteen Recipes for Preparing Dinosaur Eggs, 1,000,000 Specimens! 🦕
updates.update_content:
Hello, everyone!
I'm happy to report that Kickstarter has transferred funds to us and we're well on our way to production! THANK YOU!
Production Update!
I'm also happy to report that all tasks are proceeding on schedule!

campaign.story:
Alpha™ Pillow is a carbon infused memory foam pillow, with air cell breathability, ultra soft bamboo, pure silver fibers, and ice silk technology for instant coolness.
The Cooling Ice Silk technology helps wick away moisture and body heat to help you feel cooler so that you can fall asleep faster. Providing instant coolness and ultimate comfort.  
Silver has been used by NASA, US Special Forces, and Olympic athletes to create germ free textiles. Bamboo charcoal’s activated carbon absorb toxins, prevents mould growth and purifies air by absorbing harmful gasses.
Air Cells increase comfort and breathability that is linked to sweating and snoring during sleeping. The combination of the textiles wick moisture away twice as fast as cotton, reducing the humidity in your bed by up to 50%. 
The problem with traditional pillows is that they require porous materials to create a soft comfortable feel. In as little as 7 days, millions of colony forming units of bacteria can grow inside this permeable space where mold and other pathogens can thrive. This leads to allergies, skin irritation and many illnesses. 
Alpha's bamboo charcoal infused memory foam allows the pillow to mould into the shape of your head and neck, supporting the sensitive pressure areas to help you relax and help with insomnia. 
Impinged nerves can trigger migraines, ensuring that your spine is alined correctly in its natural position it will minimize nerve irritation. It will also help to relieve muscle tension around the neck area. 
Alpha allows your spine to be alined and it elevates your upper body, unblocking the airways and opening nasal passages so you can breathe easier. Alpha's Dimensions: 60 x 40 x 12 cm.
Silver binds to essential cell components like DNA to neutralize their harmful effect. The process of minimizing the bacteria helps with eliminating odor, prevents allergies such as skin irritations, pimples, asthma, runny nose, sneezing and more. It has taken years of development for silver fabrics to arrive at this level of quality.  
The benefits of silver used by NASA, U.S. Special Forces as well as Athletes, providing effective antimicrobial properties, which means it naturally destroys odor-causing pathogens.
To add any of our Alpha™ Collection products,  please click on your “Manage your pledge” button (on top side when you open the project page), than click “Change your pledge” and simply add to the total cost. For multiple quantities please multiply the product's cost. 
You will be able to select your preferred size or weight in the survey after the campaign ends. 
*Additional International Shipping will apply during the survey for all add-ons. 
Ivana T. Lowchareonkul is a Product Designer. She has a passion for simple interfaces. She is the ultimate problem solver and loves to create innovative products.
Science is something that she greatly enjoys. "It challenges ideas that we think are ‘right’! There is always something new and interesting to discover and the journey to get there can be really, really exciting.” said Ivana.
Ivana has played critical leadership roles in 14 successfully funded and fulfilled Kickstarter projects that have raised over $3,000,000 to over 17,000 backers. Her keen eye for innovation has given her multiple opportunities to create successful products. Her experience in manufacturing has been perfected and she is very excited to bring Alpha Sheets to volume production. 
Our past projects: 

Get Your Project Funded Today!
Get Cash Back on the Projects You Love!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our biggest challenge is to ensure that the quality meets our expectations. We will work very closely with our manufacturing partners to make sure Alpha™ Pillow is made and delivered with highest premium quality.

We are all ready to start manufacturing and together we can help to improve the lives of millions. The future of sleep is here today.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Fun Fact: Tariffs are not paid by the country it is against but the company bringing in the goods and that goes to the consumers. Trump in the US wants to increase tariffs on goods from China. It isn't the Chinese paying that, but the company importing the goods from China. That company then passes on the cost to the consumer. The way a tariff is supposed to work is by raising the cost of the imported good higher, the consumer is more likely to buy the local version that is cheaper to buy. But that isn't the case anymore when those products aren't made in your local country anymore.

campaign.story:
Our Story 
We created BeClothed because we wanted to create products that are comfortable, look great and are better for the environment.
We believe it is our mission to reinvent the relationship you have with your everyday wear. We do this by making clothing that is not only good for you but for the world too. Our clothes are designed to eliminate odour, thereby requiring you to wash them less often, leading to less wasted water, energy and wear on your clothes.
Born out the frustration that our clothes would never be the way we wanted, we set out to disrupt an outdated industry which is focused on planned obsolescence, the practice of intentionally and artificially limiting the useful life of a product for the purpose of driving more sales, something we're completely against.
We’re dedicated to crafting high-quality timeless products designed to last (and, hence, reduce waste). Our products are made from some of the best materials and are intentionally designed to last for years.
Comments on the SilverSocks
Some people who've written about us


How it works
The Cotton is intertwined with threads of our patented Silver fibers that weave in and out to ensure full coverage.
When any part of the Silver touches a bacterial cell, it breaks down its cell wall until the bacteria is no longer able to function, effectively rendering it inactive and unable to produce the pungent smell that comes when it feeds on your sweat.
Method of Application
Our patented Silver fibers are made from a specialist design allowing them to be woven directly into the fabric. During manufacture, the Cotton fibers are intertwined with our patented Silver fibers to ensure each and every surface is covered. 
Comfort, Hygiene and Versatility
The three pillars of everything we make are underscored by comfort, hygiene and versatility. We believe that every single thing you wear should be the best version that exists. 
Our main focus above all is comfort, because who's going to wear something that doesn't feel great? We try our hardest to give your clothes that extra cosy feel. You can see everything we use in our garments below.
Hygiene is the second of our pillars which is a huge part of our culture as many clothes get smelly very easily and need washing after every single wear which ultimately leads to degradation. Our garments don't smell for up to seven days, so you can pack light on that weekend away and come back wearing the clothes you went in (so you've got plenty of space for presents).
Last but by no means the least, versatility. We believe everything you buy should withstand everything you do, so whether you're at work, at the gym or even on a hike, all our clothing is made to withstand any environment so you won't need any athletic or smart versions of your clothes to take up more room in your wardrobe. 


Origins of Cotton
Grown from a soft, fluffy boll that's cultivated all over the world -  and even on the far side of the moon, - cotton is by far one of the oldest and most widespread materials around.
Usually planted in the spring, it is a perennial that lives on year after year and keeps growing. With evidence of use in the old world before 5000 BC, it sits firmly near the top of the most resilient fabrics around.
What Does It Do?
Cotton is super lightweight and durable and as a result, is one of the best base materials there is. The soft-to-the-touch quality ensures comfort and cosiness with every wear.
With its roots in the neolithic period, cotton is a reliable, weather-proof insulator that's perfect at any moment and for every occasion.
The comfortable yet flexible stretch makes cotton the perfect fabric to use in all garments, along with its hypoallergenic properties that make it a flawless favourite.
With the prominently high tensile strength of the twill weave, it's able to withstand multiple washes without a problem.
Sustainable Farming
We only source our cotton from organic crops which haven't been adulterated by genetic modification. This gives an experience as similar to the original cotton that we strive to implement. By cutting out the use of pesticides and other chemicals, we can ensure all our garments are held to a higher standard and free from allergens. 

For our first major product launch, we chose Kickstarter as the community is both intrigued by new inventions and incredibly useful as a sounding board to help us understand if our ideas would work out.
We were picked up by many outlets in the wake of our launch that by the end of it all we had shipped over 10,000+ pairs of our SilverSocks No-Show across all our platforms. This gave us the green light that we were doing something that was in very high demand and we knew we couldn't stop there.
With our first product hitting shelves and our team working tirelessly to keep up with orders on our site, we were being asked by thousands of customers if we'd be able to make our socks in a longer crew version that they were more used to. 
Even with the demand, we had to spend countless months perfecting every single aspect so as to ensure we'd release only the best version before launch day. Again, we were picked up by outlets across the globe and the SilverSocks Crew flew past its goal overnight. By the end of it all, we had shipped over 15,000+ pairs on all our platforms. 
Right now, at this moment in time, we've sold over 50,000+ pairs to over 160+ countries across the world which is something we wouldn't ever have imagined.
It's all thanks to you, our supporters. 
Thank you. 
Q: Does the SilverUnderwear only come in Cotton and these colours? 
A: If the campaign does well, we’ll add more colours and/or materials if there is demand.

Q: How much does shipping cost to my country? 
A: We offer Free Tracked Shipping across the world, wherever you are.

Q: How do I choose my colour, size, style (mens/womens) and provide my shipping address?
A: The BackerKit surveys will be sent out 14-16 days after the campaign ends.
        You'll receive them to your Kickstarter email - everything you need to give us will be provided in there.

Q: How do I track my package? 
A: You will be emailed a link three days before it goes into the carrier's system which will let you track your package every step of the way.

Q: Is there any warranty? 
A: All our products come with a one year warranty, free of charge.
            This is in addition to your statutory consumer rights.

I have another question you haven't answered here 
There are a bunch of ways to contact us to enquire or even make your thoughts known - you don't even need to back the project for some:
 Kickstarter Messages: Click here for instructions  
 Kickstarter Comments: On the project page tab - you need to back to comment
 Direct Email: shoot us an email at: support (at) beclothed (dot) com

See the rest of our range on our website
As one of the first crowdfunding marketing agencies, Enventys Partners has brought more than 750 crowdfunding projects to life through lead generation, campaign page creation, public relations, email marketing, Facebook Advertising, campaign management and more.
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 800+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $350MM raised between them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In order to ensure total transparency, the samples used in the campaign are manufactured by the very same technique that your boxers will be.

We've been through many months of prototyping to test and refine every feature and we've finalised the entire production line, right through to the quality checking and shipping.

As this is our third Kickstarter so we're well versed on the level of care that is needed to execute a campaign successfully.

Through our first and second campaigns for the SilverSocks No-Show (10,000+ pairs), SilverSocks Crew (15,000+ pairs) and our website, beclothed.com, we've now sold over 50,000 pairs of the SilverSocks.

We understand that crowdfunding campaigns can come with unexpected hiccups so we've prepared ourselves for every eventuality - including going over our goal (like we did the previous two times).

We have three backup manufacturers and packaging producers as well as two backup shippers so there is no doubt we will deliver on time.

It's imperative to us that we keep an open channel with our backers by conveying our thoughts to you every step of the way through Kickstarter comments and occasional updates to ensure you're always in the loop.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
SKYE Sneaker-Boots can be dressed up for a day in town or dressed down to coordinate with the most casual athletic clothes you own. With a no-tie lace design, you can easily slip the shoe on or off — no time wasted.
A discrete YKK zipper closure system located on the side of the shoe provides function and style. We blend our modified slip-on system with modern materials to maintain a stylish boot silhouette.
We believe that feeling amazing starts with where you stand. The sneaker-boots are lighter than most, which makes activities easier and less strenuous on your feet. The boot shell consists of 4-way stretch fabric for an extra comfortable fit.
An optimal contoured cushioning design evenly distributes the weight of your body, relieving the pressure and shock of each step. A sculpted insole provides support on the arch and heel for all-day comfort. Your feet won’t ache after a long day, bringing you a new level of comfort.
The sneaker-boots are engineered with highly durable materials such as military-grade Cordura and Japanese armor. 
The toe boxes of the shoes have TPR mudguard protection, the tips of the recycled plastic cords are dipped in rubber to prevent fraying ends, and the soles feature a unique water flushing pattern with a sawtooth profile to provide excellent grip in all types of weather.
The sneaker-boots are 100% waterproof and snowproof. 
Not only is the entire shoe welded TPR for weather protection, but it also keeps water out with a waterproof YKK zipper. The weatherproof material also has insulating layer keeping your toes warm from the cold and snow.
Our footwear is man-made with ethical manufacturing procedures. We strive to limit our carbon footprint to help preserve the environment. 
We use materials like recycled plastic and 100% natural, biodegradable rubber to create our shoes. We are also vegan-friendly — we do not use animal by-products. 
People love shoes. The average American owns about 19 pairs of shoes at one time. You might have hiking shoes, running shoes, rain boots, casual sneakers, snow boots and desert boots. Imagine buying a single pair that could work in all of these occasions. 
For those who value quality over quantity, combining your favorite, essential pairs of shoes into one sensible, attractive pair would be a dream. We made it our goal to present the eco-friendly, exceptionally crafted, affordable shoe option. Our company promises this to you, in addition to comfort, longevity and versatility. 
We can’t thank you enough for checking out our project and helping us make SKYE Sneaker-Boots a reality. 
We know not everyone will be able to support us with a pledge, but if you like SKYE Sneaker-Boots, please help us spread the word on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, and anywhere else you can think of! 
We’re only happy if you’re super-comfy and look great. We’ll be sure to exchange your shoes as long as they have not been worn outside, still have the tags attached, and are accompanied by the original receipt within 30 days of receiving the shoes. 
Once our shoes are available for retail (a few months after backers receive the early-birds), you’ll need to purchase your correct size from us at retail, and we’ll refund the difference. If there’s a manufacturing issue with your shoes, no problem, we’ve got it covered. Connect with us and we would be happy to assist.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are always certain risks that can arise at any moment during a project like this. That being said, we’re confident in our ability to produce, and have taken all the necessary measures. We have a highly qualified team and have partnered with leading manufacturing and fulfillment companies around the world. We just need your help to bring everything to fruition. Don’t worry, we’re completely prepared to bring SKYE Sneaker-Boots to you, and we have the manpower to make it happen, but if anything comes up along the way, you’ll be the first to know.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
