campaign.story:
"Dazzle is more about outsmarting than hiding." - Tauba Auerbach
A century ago, a new generation of artists in the U.S. and U.K. developed the experimental “dazzle” camouflage technique to disorient and outwit WWI enemy submarines. Drawing inspiration from animal camouflage, cubism, futurism, and vorticism, the artists used geometric patterns and colors to create avant-garde-like paint jobs, helping the Allies stay one step ahead of enemy technology. 
Left: USS Siboney leaving New York Harbor in May 1918. Right: The Women's Reserve Corps of NY demonstrate dazzle in Union Square.
This summer, multidisciplinary artist Tauba Auerbach is unveiling New York’s own 21st-century dazzle ship. Starting in July, Fireboat John J. Harvey will be painted with a visually-arresting design in vibrant red and contrasting white - the fireboat’s original colors, but with a dazzling twist.
Auerbach’s design incorporates the actual movement and behavior of water. The pattern was created through the intricate process of marbling paper, floating inks on a fluid bath and dragging combs through them before transferring ink to paper. Covering every vertical and horizontal surface of the vessel (she’s even designed special flags!), the work is the visualization of the physics of “fluid dynamics.” 
Experiencing the artwork will be FREE to the public, and will be viewable from land 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Continuing in the John J. Harvey's 18-year tradition, the public will also be invited to board and tour the boat and its immersive design on weekends while it's docked, and free boat trips around New York Harbor will be offered on weekends from July 14 to September 23!  
Flow Separation promises to surprise and fascinate New Yorkers and visitors from around the globe as it floats along the Hudson and East Rivers, docking at Brooklyn Bridge Park and Hudson River Park’s Pier 25 and Pier 66a.
With your partnership, we can make it even more accessible to the public, offering additional opportunities to experience NYC through the eyes of one of our city’s great contemporary artists!
A Benevolent Vessel
The exhibition also enables us to partner with a treasured NYC vessel: John J. Harvey. It launched as a fireboat in 1931 and served New York Harbor until it was retired in 1994 and saved by a group of enthusiasts. The boat became a national treasure on September 11, 2001 when the crew pumped water for 80 hours and evacuated people from Lower Manhattan (this story even inspired a book by Maira Kalman: Fireboat: The Heroic Adventures of the John J. Harvey).  
To realize Auerbach’s new commission, the exterior surface of John J. Harvey is being restored, stripping it of its decades-worth of chipped paint and rust, and recoated with layers of fresh paint. Following the exhibition, the fireboat will be repainted in its original, historic configuration, and continue offering free public trips as it has since 2000.
In-process photos of the boat in dry dock and being primed
The work is co-commissioned by Public Art Fund and 14-18 NOW, the United Kingdom’s award-winning public arts program commemorating the centenary of World War I. Since 2014, 14-18 NOW has commissioned hundred of new works, including the presentation of four Dazzle Ships in the U.K.     
Auerbach’s dazzled vessel is the first U.S.-based ship and the final vessel in the series before the 100th anniversary of the end of World War I on November 11, 2018.
"Dazzle came about as a desperate response to catastrophe. I'll be happy if this project sparks joy in people — if we can salvage anything positive from the wreckage of that bloody, wasteful nightmare — but it should prompt us to think about what humanity was coping with and doing to itself at the time." - Tauba Auerbach
Contemporary Dazzle Ships: Sir Peter Blake, “Everybody Razzle Dazzle”, 2015. Photo: Mark McNulty; Ciara Phillips, “Every Woman”, 2016 Photo: Ross Attenburgh
About the Artist 
Tauba Auerbach is a painter, sculptor, photographer, and publisher whose work investigates systems of logic — mathematical, linguistic, aesthetic, and spatial. A former sign painter, Auerbach frequently explores and adapts painting traditions and techniques, as well as elements of typography and calligraphy, to form abstract compositions. Auerbach has a keen understanding of how form can alter perception, a key factor in the original ‘dazzle’ patterns.  
For Flow Separation, Auerbach expands on her extensive research of ornamental wave patterns and her newer experimentation with fluid dynamics. Auerbach is intrigued by ornamental shapes and has observed and catalogued these designs, found not only in pre-historic paintings, architecture, and textiles, but in snapshots of dynamic motion in the form of rivers, and on the skeletons of coral. Her dazzle design will continue this investigation and will draw inspiration from the rhythmic designs found in the wake patterns.
Tauba Auerbach; Shadow Weave - Fret Wave, 2015. Woven canvas on wooden stretcher, 60 x 45 inches; Grain - Mandelbrot Quartet (Ventrella Variation), Tough H2O, 2017. Acrylic on canvas / Wooden stretcher, 60 x 45 inches.
"Since every boat has a wake, there's an interesting geometry to the way the fluid moves behind it, and through it, and alongside of it. I wanted to dig into that."
About Public Art Fund 
As the leader in its field, Public Art Fund brings dynamic contemporary art to a broad audience in New York City and beyond by mounting ambitious free exhibitions of international scope and impact that offer the public powerful experiences with art and the urban environment. Since 1977, Public Art Fund has distinguished itself as a pioneering organization that sets the standard for public art programs across the country, realizing over 450 projects that are as unique and memorable as New York City itself.
Left to Right: Olafur Eliasson: The New York City Waterfalls; Ai Weiwei: Good Fences Make Good Neighbors; Louise Bourgeois: Maman and Spiders; Jeppe Hein: Please Touch the Art
About 14-18 NOW
14-18 NOW is a program of extraordinary arts experiences connecting people with the First World War, as part of the U.K.’s official centenary commemorations. Since 2014 it has commissioned over 200 contemporary artists across all art forms from 35 countries, including William Kentridge, Jeremy Deller, Rachel Whiteread, Akram Khan, Jason Moran, and film directors Danny Boyle and Peter Jackson.  
The contemporary Dazzle Ship series, co-commissioned with Liverpool Biennial and supported by Bloomberg Philanthropies, has seen Dazzle Ships in London (Tobias Rehberger), Liverpool (Carlos Cruz-Diez and Sir Peter Blake) and Edinburgh (Ciara Phillips) engaging over 13 million people to date.
Why Kickstarter?
Kickstarter is a unique way for us to reach a broad audience of supporters locally, nationally, and internationally — which helps us build excitement for the project while simultaneously helping ensure its successful realization by providing crucial funds. We love how Kickstarter helps us build a community of friends and supporters who are invested in watching the exhibition develop and are passionate about innovative and ambitious public art!
Rewards
Temporary tattoo set
Special edition embroidered patch
Special edition tshirt
Special edition flag #1. Dimensions: 24" x 36"
Special edition flag #2. Dimensions: 24" x 36"
Special edition flag #3. Dimensions: 24" x 36"
Special edition flag #4. Dimensions: 24" x 36"
Digital wallpaper
Public Art Fund exhibition variety pack
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every Public Art Fund project presents a new set of challenges to navigate — such is the reality of commissioning ambitious and boundary-pushing works of art in unconventional places! However, our team has been hard at work for many months ironing out the kinks. 

In fact, we now fancy ourselves experts in maritime law, harbor topography, marine-grade paint and supplies, nautical terminology, and so much more. Painting is currently underway and we look forward to seeing the dazzled fireboat set out for its maiden voyage on the water this summer. 

As a not-for-profit organization, it’s only through the support of our community that we can make artists’ dreams a reality, so that they may surprise and fascinate New Yorkers and visitors from across the globe with the fruits of their labor. Thank you for being a part of this incredible project!

--

Your pledge is tax-deductible. Where goods and services are provided by Public Art Fund in exchange for your contribution, the tax deductible amount excludes the fair market value of the goods and services provided.

--
 
Images courtesy of Tauba Auerbach.
Video by SandenWolff.

--
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
We hope you've had a chance to check out Flow Separation at Brooklyn Bridge Park's Pier 6 this month. If you haven't yet, the boat is open for visitors from 12:00-4:00pm on Saturdays and 3:00-7:00pm on Sundays.
Boat trips are currently sold out, but we'll be releasing more tickets next week. Or if you'd like to try your hand at a standby spot on Saturdays at 4:30pm or 6:00pm or Sundays at 12pm or 1:30pm, you can come join the standby line for first-come-first-serve spots based on capacity.

updates.update_userinfo: We’re adding more trips & releasing more tickets!
updates.update_content:
Have you been dazzled yet?! Flow Separation is now officially docked and on view at Brooklyn Bridge Park's Pier 6! We hope you'll make it over to the Brooklyn waterfront to check it out while it's there (through August 12), or will head over to Hudson River Park's Pier 25 later this summer (August 13 - September 23) to see and experience the work in person.
In celebration of July 4th, tomorrow the fireboat will be making a special appearance at The Frying Pan (located on Hudson River Park's Pier66a) and will offer . The special Independence Day trips are . will return to Brooklyn Bridge Park's Pier 6 at 5 pm. If you're in town tomorrow, we hope to see you there!

We are thrilled to announce that we hit our $10,000 goal -- just three days into the campaign! -- all thanks to our incredible backers. We are blown away by the generosity and enthusiasm of our friends and supporters.
If you haven’t yet backed the campaign, there is still plenty of time to be a part of it. We have many fantastic rewards available through July 11, including artist-designed t-shirts, patches, temporary tattoos, and special-edition flags. All pledges that go above-and-beyond our funding goal will be put to very good use making this project a reality.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are launching this crowdfunding campaign in order to fund the costs of producing hand-crafted batches and offering them at an affordable price. It's a challenge to produce carefully hand-crafted batches with high consistency. We have logistics and production set up to ensure reward delivery by July. 
 
Due to heat conditions at this time of year, we package each shipment in reusable insulated containers. We do not keep any of the shipping costs. In fact, we pay the majority of the actual shipping cost ourselves. Higher level packages are free shipping, so you get more for your money. Please retrieve package immediately upon arrival.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: An INCREDIBLE Year! Let's Finish Strong!
updates.update_content:
We have successfully shipped out all reward packages, and the feedback that we've received from you has been amazing! Thank you all so much for making Pocket Latte possible. Words cannot express our gratitude. We genuinely hope that you keep up with us as we continue to wake this tired world up! As always, feel free to reach out to us, and definitely keep in touch. 
Our website is live at www.pocketlatte.com. You can also follow us for updates on instagram/facebook (@pocketlatte).

updates.update_userinfo: Official Launch on AMAZON PRIME! (& a special gift for you)
updates.update_content: It’s been a long 30 days. Our team has seen many sleepless nights to ensure that we deliver the best experience possible to our backers. We came in with the mere goal of $5,000 to help us start our journey. But with your tremendous support, we have kickstarted that journey beyond our own expectations, surpassing 240% of that goal! Early in this project, Kickstarter’s staff selected us as a “Project We Love”, propelling us to reach our full goal is less than two weeks. Our Kickstarter project has now come to a close, but Pocket Latte does not end here. We’re excited for you to be a part of our bigger picture!

With big thanks to all of you, we have exceeded our expectations by so much that we are upgrading our production capabilities and facility to keep up with the increasing demand. We are announcing a new stretch goal of $12,000 to cover the costs of our upgrades, equipment, and bringing more members to our team. We're ready to take it to the next level! We have even begun experimenting with secret new flavors! ;) (Message us with any suggestions you have!)

With two weeks left on the clock, we're continuing to soar past our goal! Production is at full-speed, and we're excited to share this with you all very soon! 
As a reminder, we are having a launch party on June 29th 5-9pm at Cafe Dulce in Los Angeles, California (address below). If you are in the area and able to attend, we would love to meet you! All backers will receive a free bar and a chance for some special gifts.

updates.update_userinfo: Our First Chapter Comes to a Close, but Stay Tuned For a Long Journey Ahead!
updates.update_content:
We have reached our goal!! Thanks so much to all the backers and supporters. We got to our goal in less than 2 weeks! Let’s see where we can end up by the end of the Kickstarter! We’re prepared to ship out rewards at the end of our Kickstarter, and hope to get them to you as soon as we can!
We would like to announce a launch party in Los Angeles on Friday, June 29, 5-9pm! If you are in the area, we would love to meet you. We are giving free bars to the first 100 people and all Kickstarter backers. Our event flyer is below. For event details and to RSVP, view here:

campaign.story: Featured On:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We’ve finished prototyping and early beta testing FibINK. Both the mattifying and removal formulas have been formulated and produced. 
 During the remainder of this campaign we will refine the look and feel of the packaging, add more artists and art to the portfolio, and begin the tooling phase, where we will purchase the proper manufacturing and lab equipment that will help us produce FibINK at scale. We have our suppliers locked up and we’re confident in our process, materials and ingredients.

Shipping is estimated to begin in late August 2018. There's always the risk of production deadlines being slightly delayed, in which case you would receive your Fibink's a few weeks later than expected.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The first pocket-sized dolly for smartphones and cameras, makes it possible for everyone to capture cinematic footage. Now it is easier than ever to achieve perfect linear and curved movements with only one tool.
A new way of use; Attaching the Gimbals to Muwi will bring you 4-Axis Motion & Target Tracking ability. Thanks to the gimbal technology, now Muwi has the power of thousands of dollars cost equipment.
PLAY

With our incoming App, Cameras will move smarter.
Whether you're a pro or an amateur, MUWI makes professional videography available to anyone, anywhere and at any time.
With a retractable phone holder and patent-pending rotary legs, MUWI allows you to achieve perfect linear and curved movement with only one tool.
   MUWI is handy. You can easily achieve truck, pan and dolly shots.
Our mission is to empower and inspire people to tell better stories and to make professional videography available for anyone, anywhere at any time.
We’ve tried hard to develop additional abilities for MUWI to make it easy to use and boost your creativity.
FLOW is the most intuitive and simple way to get automated motion. Just turn it on and scroll for speed adjustment.
Turn MUWI into a motorized dolly with just one click. FLOW is totally compatible with MUWI’s rotary legs and other add-ons.
With FLOW-X, MUWI becomes completely hands-free. You can adjust speed, direction and control your camera remotely.
Via Bluetooth connection and remote controller, MUWI starts to shoot and moves at the same time.
Muwi App is under development and will come soon with a firmware release update to your Flow X. With the help of the App you will able to control your cameras more precise and smarter.
FLOW X will go fast enough to follow the action and slow enough to capture perfect time-lapses.
TRACK will turn your MUWI into a lightweight and easy to setup slider that can be mounted to any tripod.
No need to worry about how to ride MUWI without a surface. TRACK is designed for both outdoor and indoor usage with or without a tripod.
TRACK is made from airplane grade aluminum to ensure the best quality and stability. It’s foldable and compact, just put it into your backpack and discover the world.
SWIVEL CLIP is the smartest way to attach any camera. Just snap the SWIVEL-CLIP, and mount your DLSR, mirrorless or action camera.
The snap-on clip grabs MUWI safe, rigid and steady enough to never let them swinging.
MUWI is compatible with the most of the smartphone and action cam gimbals.
The secure ball joint will allow you to point your camera 360 degrees steadily.
MUWI and the add-ons, togather, is the most sleek, portable and easy to use videography gear ever designed. See the below table for rewards for the possible early bird and Kickstarter prices.
IMPORTANT NOTE: Above prices are all inclusive prices. The $20 shipping costs added. Just change your final pledge amount to above prices. Thanks.


Will the shipping fee be EU friendly? Will be an additional VAT / tax charge when it arrives at the door. What about also for the rest of the world as well?
To make our backers to avoid these kinds of disappointment and more over to not make them lose any money we have planned to make shipments via fulfillment centers in 3 different major locations in EU/US/AU. The products will be shipped first to these centers than they will be posted to your addresses. There will be NO EXTRA CHARGES or NO HIDDEN FEES.
Photographers, videographers, film makers, directors, bloggers, students, hobbyists, professionals and amateurs with motion picture passion. Watch our stories and share yours with us.
PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

PLAY

Please follow MUWI in social medial and help us to make it reach all over the world. Thank you for your support!
                                                      This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 475+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $225MM raised between them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We know very well how to prepare for the product development process and how to deal with problems that may occur in any stage. We made our business plan perfectly. Designing, prototyping, and testing were finally finished after many MUWI iterations. We have suppliers and vendors that we have been working with for more than 10 years. 

However, developing an innovative product always carries risks in the production stage that might not be foreseeable. These can create delays and extra costs. That’s why, from the very beginning ‘til the end, we tested and tested MUWI with users to eliminate as many risks as possible. And, in the end, we came to the result: that MUWI works perfectly, allowing us to take all the video footage that you’ve seen. 

We’ve worked really hard and are still pushing harder and harder. Our purpose is not only delivering MUWI on time to our Kickstarter backers, but to deliver it better than you see. We aim to expand the MUWI family through more innovative video motion control products for everyone. So, as MUWI is our core structure, it must be perfect (with all its add-ons) and must give %100% backer satisfaction. 
We believe in transparency and promise to always keep you updated on the process. And we’ll try to answer all your questions on time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Man, I really wanted to like this product. I really, really did. Every aspect of this product falls short in some way. The Muwi X doesn't seem to have enough power or weight to really push it along the track. The track itself has sharp edges and I feel like it's going to scratch the hell out of the Muwi and the Muwi X. The clip for DSLRs is a joke and the swivel ball has very little tension (even with my shortest lens AND lightest body setup). The smart phone footage is unusable because the amount of vibration is so intense. The app that's supposed to help with smart phones isn't available yet. And to top it all off, the Muwi X gets caught in some parts of the track or changes speeds slightly (even on a granite surface and seemingly randomly). I just can't find a way to use this thing and get good results. I want a refund and I am even willing to pay the shipping to send it back.

Got mine last month. Balanced my Pocket 4k camera on top and is able to move pretty well on flat surface, not sure about inclines. The way the motor is attached to the main body it tends to loose grip unless weight is put on top of it. Going to come up with a design to attach bigger cameras on the main body.

Does anyone have any ideas on how to add a weight to the back end of flow x that doesn’t interfere with the remote control? The issue I am running into is with heavier systems, like my move freefly and iPhone XS with moment lens causes the Muwi to press down on the flow x where it connects to the Muwi. This causes the back end of the flow x module to lift up on the back end and it loses traction. This is not really an issue with smaller systems, like my Osmo Pocket or the phone by itself. The use of my Movi freefly does seem to mitigate and in most cases eliminate the OIS warp and wobble, I think that is more from the weight of the Movi than the gimbal but who knows.

Received my MUWI, Flow X and Track M today. Everything was intact and as described. So far after using it for about a half hour; MUWI does everything it was promised to do. The quality is about what I expected for a low budget, motorized, phone camera slide. My only complaint right now is that the phone clip doesn’t open very far. I have an iPhone XR and I was able to fit it but felt as though I was pushing the limits of the clip. Aside from that the functionality is great. As a product designer myself I understand the iterations a product goes through from concept through prototype before being released. I’d say as with any new product there will always be room for improvement and I’m sure the next MUWI revision will be even better but this is a great compact design and I’m looking forward to taking this with me on the go.
Overall, it should meet the immediate needs I have for producing a video for a small consumer product. Longevity of the product is a...wait and see.

Got my MUWI today this thing is really cool. There were two things that are minor that but one clip on the motor does not snap onto the piece that holds the camera and I don’t think I got legs for my M track. I will email MUWI and ask them about it but I’m not too worried. I was going to use a tripod I have to hold the M Track anyway so no biggie. This thing is awesome I’m loving it. Awesome little device. Thanks again MUWI.

Got the Muwi today (I'm in eastern NY)... well the track came the other day and the muwi proper showed up the next day. My needs and expectations for this are modest. I spent some time playing around and I will say I like it! Other that have posted more indepth reviews are not entirely wrong in their observations though- but It's gonna work well for what I need. Doubtful I'll use it for a cellphone, or a bigger mirrorless or dslr format, a majority of the time I'll probably use a gopro on it- and it seems to work fine for that. I got the Track S and while it does feel a little short with the muwi and flow on it. There's still plenty of movement in the shot. The main thing for me is the portability and this will come in real handy! BTW the case for the Tracks and the muwi are pretty much the same size so it was very easy to just lift out the cut foam from the muwi case and tuck it into the lid of the Track S case, so I am able to keep everything combined into one case). Thanks to Muwi for delivering their product... and pretty much as advertised; I look foward to using it and to seeing what they do next!
All and all it’s an ok product, I personally don’t even think it was worth what I paid at the Kickstarter discount.

And now a quick review from the couple hours I've had it: I received my Muwi today from FedEx. Indianapolis, Indiana, USA. There are no noticeable issues with the Muwi unit itself. However, it does not move smoothly through my Track-S without an undue amount of manual force, and the FlowX unit most certainly does not have the oomph to even budge Muwi on the track. With that, I'm sad about that, as I was up to this point thinking about getting the largest track from the Indiegogo campaign. FlowX is also *much* louder than I'd hoped it would be, but it's liveable for slower movement, so long as I'm using off-camera audio gear. The time lapse function works really well on the FlowX. I'm just using my iPhone, with a 3rd party camera app for time lapse. But the time lapse buttons on the remote work well.

THE MOVEMENTS
Mechanicals The “Mechanicals” product range heralds the return of the Ronda Brand’s mechanical watch movements. The recently launched automatic movement operates with a winding mechanism on both sides by means of a ball bearing. – “Ronda Mecano”,
Visit our website for more info w. www.coastudios.com

Hi Guys,
Just to let you know, with lots of demand for the re-launch of our Eclipse watches, we’ve decide to go ahead with this today at 10PM GMT. We really appreciate everyone’s support. We hope this time around we will reach our target so we can put the watches into production.
Thanks All COA Studios
Thank you to every backer who has supported us in "the eclipse" project so far! We are just half way to being 100% funded, fingers crossed for the remaining 50%.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We’ve finished prototyping and early beta testing FibINK. Both the mattifying and removal formulas have been formulated and produced. 
 During the remainder of this campaign we will refine the look and feel of the packaging, add more artists and art to the portfolio, and begin the tooling phase, where we will purchase the proper manufacturing and lab equipment that will help us produce FibINK at scale. We have our suppliers locked up and we’re confident in our process, materials and ingredients.

Shipping is estimated to begin in mid-July 2018. There's always the risk of production deadlines being slightly delayed, in which case you would receive your Fibink's a few weeks later than expected.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
It’s about being free, mobile, and carrying just what you need. Protect your phone and more with Angle Bag!
 It's Angle Bag! The newest waterproof solution for keeping those items you want to protect safe - both in and out of the water! That's right! You can secure this handy waterproof solution to your body and jump right into the water with the peace of mind knowing that your valuables are secure, safe, and dry.   
                                          Trust Angle Bag's compact and sleek design to keep everything from your keys to your IDs safe while you explore the city, enjoy a night out, and even participate in your favorite water sports!
We all know it can be tough keeping your valuables safe from harm and theft, especially at the beach. Angle Bag's innovative design protects what you need, keeping your items close, safe, and secure. Let Angle Bag protect your items from sand as you walk around the beach, and water when you feel like a swim on a hot summer day. Keep those summer holidays stress free with Angle Bag!
Keep prying eyes off your valuables. Angle Bags textile molding technology doesn't just add to its sleek design and security capabilities - it also adds an extra layer of visual protection to give you complete privacy about what you are carrying. Angle Bag keeps prying eyes away and gives you the confidence to life your life without fear of theft.
Angle Bag’s superb construction ensures that the main compartment stays waterproof! 
                                       This gives you an extra layer of protection for your valuables both in and out of the water!
Angle Bag was designed to store your most valuable items while you enjoy a day at the beach, and excursion into the outdoors, or just enjoy the sights around a city. Its stylish compact design features a vertical access pocket that provides convenient access to your items. 
Just place your phone, keys, wallet, or just any other small valuable into the vertical access pocket and go about your day knowing that your items are protected, safe, and secure with you at all times!
The Smart Organization System lets you carry the most with multiple compartments designed for easy no-fuss access. Angle Bag’s main compartment is perfect for your passport, wallet, keys, jewellery, and more! The Smart Organization System also features additional compartments designed specifically for your phone and other items you want quick access to such as your keys and headphones. 
                                     The Smart Organization System, coupled with Angle Bag’s triangular and compact design makes give it all the storage space you need to keep your items safe, dry, and close to you.
Angle Bag’s innovative 45 degree position gives the wearer minimum resistance and maximum sliding in water.
The one-of-a-kind triangular design ensures trouble-free access to your valuables.
A Full Cushion Support system makes Angle Bag easy to wear for everyday use, giving you the support and comfort you need for any activity!
It’s easy to see how Angle Bag’s unique triangular design is the only option for maximum storage capacity, safety, and support!
The triangular design isn't the only thing that makes Angle Bag the smart choice for security, protection, and comfort. The outer layer of Angle Bag is industrially designed with thermoform flexible materials that adds to its stylish level of protection.
                                   With a stylish appearance and versatility, Angle Bag is must have for any occasion! Wear it comfortably and confidently on a night out with friends, to a party, or as you explore the city.
Angle Bag also makes a fantastic gift for anyone who appreciates safety, quality, versatility, and style!
The Ventiprene Technology in Angle Bag creates channels which allow for heat and sweat from the body to process through the material as water vapor. Built in to Angle Bag as a soft mesh, this quick-drying fabric technology keeps your skin cooler, drier, and more comfortable in hot or humid climates.
Interwoven in a crosshatch pattern throughout Angle Bag is an advanced layer of Ripstop material. This TPU coated lightweight material enhances Angle Bag’s waterproof and rip resistant capabilities.
Trust the revolutionary materials in Angle Bag to give you the Best in breathability, comfort, and protection in any activity that you do!
Versatility is about more than a compact design, sleek look, revolutionary materials, or comfort. Versatility requires that you can take what you need when you need it and be assured the same protection and comfort the entire time.
 Angle Bag meets your needs with a fashionable leather case that is classy, durable, and best of all - removable. This handmade glasses case will hold any glasses up to an L size. 
Neoprene, the revolutionary technology that allows for additional breathability, is what is used to create Angle Bag’s fully adjustable waist strap. This stretchy material is incredibly durable, lightweight, and resilient to the weathering caused by the elements and repeated use. 
The Double Lock Buckle is designed to be lightweight and firm, guaranteeing you top performance and safety- even in big waves! Even the zipper on Angle Bag is specifically designed for hassle-free and quick-access to your valuables at anytime.
Angle Bag’s versatility and standards are unparalleled on the market. No other bag will offer you the versatility, style, technology, and security that you will get with Angle Bag!
  When we say anywhere, we mean anywhere! Don’t left fear of theft or damage stop you from living your life! Angle Bag keeps your items safe and secure in any situation! Enjoy the comfort and support as you hike through the mountains or cycle your favorite trail. Be confident that your items will stay dry and protected in water as you surf, swim, dive, or snorkel. Angle Bag is guaranteed to protect your items in water up to 20 feet!
Angle Bag’s level of protection, durability, and comfort won’t keep any thrill seeker from getting the most out of their outdoor adventure. 
Angle Bag is a must have for any traveler who requires the best in safety, support, and versatility!
                        Get Cash Back on the Projects You Love!
                 "We are a team that is passionate about creating great design products. One day during a vacation, we were faced with a problem - out stuff was stolen while we were enjoying a sunny day at the beach. We came back from swimming to find that our phones, keys, wallets, and money were missing! We decided to create beautiful and comfortable bag that keeps your valuables stored, safe, and secure anywhere you want to go. Angle Bag is the answer to a stress free active life!" - Olen Olemas (Creator)
"We took only the most most revolutionary materials and combined them with a stylish and comfortable design. We strive to create quality bags and active gear specifically designed for people who live, work, and play in urban environments. We truly love what we do and put that passion into every project." - Jennifer Downs (Operations)
"Angle Bag started as a design sketch after having our valuable stolen at the beach. We have come a long way from sketches to produce a design that we are confident is top of the line." - Eva Allas (Finance)
Get Your Project Funded Today!

updates.update_content:
Hello Guys!
In case if you or your friends missed our Angle Bag campaign here on KS, still you can find us on Indiegogo:
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/angle-bag-waterproof-beach-swimming-belt-bag-water#/

FUNDED and STILL GROWING! It’s been a an amazing adventure this past month. We are absolutely amazed by our success and deeply grateful for all of your support.
We're in the last 24 hour window and so close for the second stretch goal.

In order to ensure the water resistance of our Angle Bag, we will have to stick some existing rules, that are already defined for waterproof bags / dry bags. The first main point should be materials, after long discussions and consultations, we chose Ventiprene, it is actually the new generation waterproof neoprene. Neoprene has many advantages such as waterproof and thermal insulation, but it is not breathable as it is constructed with closed-cell structure. While retaining many of the great features of neoprene, Ventiprene patented technology creates channels which allow body heat and sweat go through as water vapor.

Which means that when we go swimming, we'll essentially be wearing an inflatable float around our waists, making it harder to dive below the surface. The easy remedy is for us to squeeze as much air out of the bag as possible before sealing it shut, so I'm just wondering: how well will the bag's material and shape stand up to repeated squishing? (The better remedy is to add a valve that would let us squeeze the air out after the zipper is closed, but I assume that's too complex and costly to add at this point.) Thanks!

@AngleBag - Thank-you for the new buckle! One suggestion for you that would make Angle Bag even better: could you include a lanyard in the main pocket that could be used to attach to items? The reason I ask is that one really nice use for Angle Bag is water sports (ie, windsurfing, kiteboarding, stand up paddling, etc) - in those sports you often want an emergency kit on you in case you get into trouble in bad weather (ie, storm conditions) - when that happens and you need to access contents in the bag (ie, to get out your phone) you are often in big waves on an unstable board so it's very easy to drop things and the last thing you want to drop is your phone if you need help. By having a lanyard in the pocket when you retrieve things you could be sure you won't lose them. If you can't do a lanyard at least sew in a strong loop or small D-ring inside the pocket so people could attach their own lanyard. Thanks!

campaign.story:
Anywhere Tools is a major addition to Keyport's modular everyday carry system by introducing a series of new tech and tool modules along with another way to carry them - the Anywhere Pocket Clip. The Pocket Clip and improved modular stacking system gives you a whole new array of carry options for Keyport Modules in addition to attaching them to the Keyport Pivot and Keyport Slide 3.0. The Keyport system is the most advanced EDC solution available because of its one-of-a-kind modularity, its broad range of customization choices, and its wide variety of carry options.
Anywhere Tools are part of a system designed upon the principals of  convenience, utility, and style. Our goal is to transform your everyday carry from a bulky, oddly shaped, noisy assemblage of things you always haul around with you to a fully customized set of tools and tech that accompany you on all of your adventures without getting in the way.
Modular - Take only the items you want with you. No need to schlep a bulky, jingly jangly, pocket full of keys and other oddly shaped personal items alongside a fixed tool with several implements you will rarely, if ever, use.
Stackable - Several of the modules are stackable (we call them mid-modules) meaning you can carry more than one together on a single pocket clip. Both the MOCA II and the NEBA Knife Modules are mid-modules which allows other modules to be stacked on top of them. Mid-modules are easily identified by their machined aluminum scales with the three square holes. The Pocket Flare Mini-Flashlight and WeeLINK Cable Charger are outer modules, which means that they can stack on top of a mid-module but cannot be stacked upon as they form the top or outer most layer.
Easily stack Modules w/our no-fastener system - Anywhere Pocket Clip + NEBA Knife + WeeLINK Cable Charger Module = Custom Wearable Multi-Tool
Quick and Easy On / Off - Modules are easily added or removed from the Pocket Clip, Pivot or Slide with our RuSH Module Removal Tool or a heavy-duty paperclip, pen, or other device with a simple point.
Removing modules is a snap with the RuSH Module Removal Tool
Wide Range of Uses - There are so many ways to carry Anywhere Tools... on a pocket clip, on multiple pocket clips, dangling from a carabiner, on a keychain, on a backpack, on a purse, with a Keyport Pivot, or with a Keyport Slide 3.0.
Stylish - Anywhere Tools provide a cleaner, more personalized, minimalist approach to your everyday carry.
Keyport Compatible - All of the modules in this campaign are compatible with both the Keyport Slide 3.0 (sold separately) and the Keyport Pivot (available as an add-on for 25% OFF). Equal parts modular key organizer + custom multi-tool + exclusive lost & found recovery service all-in-one, Keyport devices complete the ultimate fully customizable everyday carry system.
Anywhere Tech and Tool Modules are also compatible with the Keyport Slide 3.0 (sold separately) & Keyport Pivot (available as an add-on for 25% OFF)
Think of it as a sophisticated alternative to Batman's utility belt... minus the extra 10 pounds, the shiny yellow belt, and the need to wear tights to pull off that whole look.
Anywhere Tech Tools are an efficient and much better looking alternative to Batman's utility belt
Integrated Your Valuable Feedback
Like our previous Kickstarter campaigns, we have integrated a great deal of your feedback from our initial set of tools along with feedback on other products in the marketplace to make our latest products stronger, more versatile, and more useful.
Anywhere Pocket Clip™
Constructed of one piece hardened spring steel, the Anywhere Pocket Clip uses the same cutting-edge modular attachment feature as the Keyport Pivot and Slide 3.0.  The unique no-fastener design allows you to attach and detach modules in a literal snap. It can also be used as a money clip. All modules that fit the Pivot and Slide 3.0 are compatible with the Pocket Clip.
MOCA™ II Module
Designed especially with Slide owners in mind, the MOCA II (11-In-1) is an update on our MOCA 10-In-1 Multi-Tool. We have updated the design to feature a unique stowage latch, a 180 degree stop, and refined the tip to include both a Phillips and a flathead screwdriver, along with an improved cord cutter that slices through boxes, cords, and nearly anything else with ease. The MOCA II is a mid-module, so you can stack other modules or Side Plates on top of the scale for extra comfort and personalization.
Tools included: Bottle Opener • Flathead Screwdriver • Phillips Head Screwdriver • Cord Cutter • Box Opener • Scoring Tool • Hex Bit Driver • 1/4 inch Wrench • 5/16 inch Wrench • 3/8 inch Wrench • 1 inch Ruler + 1 cm Ruler
NEBA Knife™ Module
Named in honor of our fallen team member, Nebiyu Detti, this high quality edc pocketknife carries on his name and spirit. Whenever anyone needed a little help, Neb was always there with his signature slogan, "I got you." The NEBA Knife continues in this tradition with a stylish, beefier pocketknife that will serve you well in a pinch. The slip-joint knife features a 2" clip point blade and an improved spring mechanism with a half stop and thumb jibbing for extra grip. With the Pocket Clip attached it is very comfortable to hold with no unpleasant hot spots. The NEBA Knife is also a mid-module, so you can stack other modules or Side Plates on top of it.
Pocket Flare™ Module
An upgrade from our base mini-flashlight unit, the Pocket Flare is over two times brighter (27 lumens vs. 12 lumens max output) and features lamp mode, a lantern-style light around the entire base of the module to cast a wider light than that of the front beam. We also replaced the slider button with a push button. The Pocket Flare is rechargeable via USB micro, displaying red during charge mode and green when fully charged.
WeeLINK™ Charger Cable Module
Everyone these days appears to be carrying multiple charger cables stuffed in their backpack, purse, or even pocket. Yet, as the old saying goes, it feels like there is never one around when you need it most. Enter the WeeLink Charger Cable Module. Available in USB to Micro USB, USB to Lightning, and USB to USB-C, WeeLINK charger cables are easily accessible to keep all of your most important devices powered up.
Available charging connector options for all kinds of phones, tablets, and other rechargeable tech.
ParaPull
Alongside the Anywhere Pocket Clip, we designed two products that work in concert to complement the system.
The ParaPull is a short paracord zipper pull style lanyard that makes it easy to pull your Pocket Clip out when you need to get a handle on it.  The ParaPull works equally well connecting loose items to either a Pivot or a Slide.
RuSH Multi-Purpose Tool
Remove / Screw / Hang - The RuSH Multi-Purpose Tool makes removing modules, particularly stacked modules, a piece of cake. The RuSH Tool doubles as a suspension clip and features a bottle opener and flathead screwdriver to tighten / loosen the Pivot screw. In addition, the RuSH Tool can be stowed in a Pivot without having to disassemble it.
While we are launching a large number of products, we want to give you as much choice as we can without complicating things and compromising fulfillment schedules. Based upon your feedback from our last Kickstarter, we have added discounts to ALL reward levels, so even late-comers to the party get a break for their support.  Obviously, the sooner you pledge, the bigger the discount, and the sooner we hit our goal, the sooner we can let our manufacturing partners know to get started and the more stretch goals we can unlock!
SPECIAL NOTE - It came to our attention that we are missing 2 Pocket Flare Mini-Flashlight Modules in the EDC Essentials 2X Reward Description.  Our mistake.  That reward does come with 2 Pocket Flares, and we will make certain that anyone who pledges that Reward will receive them.
To keep it simple there is one major rule that accompanies the above rewards and add-on menu.
Rule #1 and Only (as of right now...)
Pricing for Add-Ons to ANY and ALL reward levels comes from the Add-On Menu. To say it another way, early bird pricing DOES NOT apply to add-ons. To calculate your Add-On pricing, simply add the total dollar amount of the add-ons you would like from the Add-On Menu and add it to your existing reward level. This is how we will reconcile all pricing in BackerKit.
For example, if I choose the Starter Kit Reward Level and want to add a Charger Cable Module (regardless of when I do so in the campaign), I will add the Charger Cable Module price found in the Add-On Menu @ $16, which represents a 11% discount off of the projected MSRP of $17.99, to the existing reward pledge of $18 for a total of $34 before shipping.
Stretch Goals
Stretch Goal #1 @ $65,000 - Spectrum and Black Pocket Clips - UNLOCKED
Alongside Gun Grey, we have added two color options to the Anywhere Pocket Clip - Black and Spectrum.
Stretch Goal #2 @ $100,000 - Select Side Plates @ $3 (50% OFF MSRP) - UNLOCKED
Those of you who are familiar with our universal access devices, the Keyport Pivot and Keyport Slide 3.0, may be familiar with Side Plates. Side Plates can sit on top on a mid-module like an outer module and show off your personal style. So for Stretch Goal #2 @ $100K, we are offering six side plate options at just $3 per unit (50% OFF MSRP):
Digital Camo
Woodland Camo
Carbon Fiber
Rainbow
Black on Black
Black on White
See Side Plate image under Stretch Goal #3.5.
These side plates are not available anywhere else, and you will be the first to receive them.
Stretch Goal #3 @ $125,000 - FREE Select Side Plate! - UNLOCKED
We will give you each a FREE side plate (your choice of one of the six above) if... scratch that... WHEN we hit Stretch Goal #3 at $125,000.

Stretch Goal #3.5 - Additional Side Plates - UNLOCKED
As a thank you for your continued support and enthusiasm, we have added four additional side plate options based upon your input (Stars & Stripes, Zebra Wood, Kickstarter Green/Blue/Teal?, and #TeamOrange). Here is the final list of 10 Side Plates from which you may choose a FREE one.
In addition to your FREE Side Plate, these will also be available in BackerKit for only $3 each (50% OFF MSRP).

Stretch Goal #4 @ $150,000
If we hit $150K, we will offer 3 additional ParaPull colors (Gun Grey, Army Green, and Red) alongside Black.

As we have done for both campaigns before, we are going to use BackerKit to administrate the fulfillment process after the campaign. Once we migrate to BackerKit, we will send you out a survey that will help us to review and break down your pledge into the specific rewards you ordered along with their associated costs.
BackerKit will also allow the opportunity for additional purchases, but please keep in mind that Kickstarter will offer the best reduced price options.
SPECIAL NOTE - Super Early Bird rewards list an estimated delivery of September, which is incorrect and could not be changed once it was noticed since those rewards were live.  We expect Super Early Bird rewards to ship at the same time as all other rewards and estimate delivery to be in October.
Tentative Schedule
April 18 - Launch Kickstarter
April & May - Integrate consumer feedback, finalize design for manufacturing, finalize quotes (4 weeks)
May 18 - Complete Kickstarter campaign
May 20 thru 31 - Place tooling and production p.o.’s
June & July - Complete production tooling, first shots (8 weeks)
August - Initiate pilot runs of each product, initial beta testing, assuming production tweaks are minor, move ahead with production runs (4 weeks)
September - Production runs (6 weeks)
October - Final QC, package, and ship to backers (2 weeks)
October 31 - Complete fulfillment to all backers
Because of the large number of independent items in production at the same time (6), we will fulfill each order as soon as all of those products for that particular order have been received, tested, and packaged.
Unless we encounter an unforeseen issue which delays one or more products more than four weeks from the estimated end of the campaign, we will not be splitting shipments.
Help Us Spread the Word!
Help us spread the word by clicking on icons (Facebook, Twitter, email, link shortener) underneath the Back this project button (circled in red) at the top right of the page.
Join our VIP Email List
At Keyport, we think of our supporters as extended members of our team, and we want to hear from you.
Please make sure to sign up for our VIP email list which includes giveaways, discounts, and access to limited edition runs.
Follow Us on Social Media
We like you... Like us on Facebook.
Follow us on Instagram for the best of Keyport, EDC, and other cool partner products.
Check out all of our videos here including setup guides and insider tips.
Follow us on Twitter, and we'll drop some Keyport science on you.
Follow us on Pinterest and check out not only what we build, but also other things we love.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While it is true that product development is fraught with challenges for even the most seasoned team, we have done a great deal to mitigate the risks while adhering to an aggressive, but achievable schedule that gets rewards out as quickly as possible.

TEAM
Keyport has been around for more than ten years and developed a reputation for high quality products coupled with exceptional customer support. Our core management team (Josh, David, and Aimee) have worked together for over five years now, and we have been through the twists and turns, the ups and downs of bringing complex projects to fruition many times.

EXPERIENCE
This isn’t our first rodeo. Keyport has already completed two successful Kickstarter campaigns, both of which had multiple products and very aggressive project timelines. In our last Kickstarter campaign alone, we launched a half dozen new products at once.

MANUFACTURING
We have worked together with our primary manufacturer, who is overseeing the production of all of these products, for nearly two years now. Together we have developed over a dozen products with tens of thousands of units in the field.

In an effort to speed up the time to delivery, we anticipate initiating tooling early in the campaign instead of waiting until our project has been funded and the funds have been received.

COMMUNICATION
Most importantly, we know the unparalleled value of consistent and transparent communication with you… our most ardent supporters. We have enough experience to know that there are ups and downs with every project, and we will keep you posted on our progress so that you are with us every step of the way on this adventure... and ask anyone who backed our last project, our updates always entertain as well as inform :)
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey Anywhere Tools Backers!
Just wanted to let you know that we are launching our next campaign, OmniFob, on Kickstarter one week from today - Wednesday, July 17th.  Early Bird slots are expected to fill up quickly.
Apologies if you have received a similar email from one of our previous Kickstarter campaigns; if that is the case, you can ignore this one. Thanks for your continued support.

updates.update_userinfo: One Fob to Rule Them All - OmniFob Launches 🚀 on Kickstarter in 1 Week - Wednesday, July 17
updates.update_content: We wanted to reach out and congratulate you because Anywhere Tools™ by Keyport has been selected as a Finalist for Carryology's Best EDC Carry Award. Now you can vote for your favorite!

comments.content: Further to my previous comment, I would like to point out how incredibly helpful the customer service has been in resolving my issue. This already fantastic company has gone up even more in my humble opinion and I'll definitely be backing them again and wholeheartedly recommend to anyone!

This has been absolutely great - up until today when I reached into my pocket to get my keys only to find a handful of components.. The Anywhere Tools are absolutely perfect, but the Keyport has just completely come apart. Lucky it was in my pocket so nothing was lost!

After a great deal of scratching up my Keyport and callousing my fingers, I somehow managed to get the MOCA module to pop off using a Victorinox mini screwdriver (which I nearly broke), and thankfully that was the right side to tighten my Pivot... So things are fixed for now, but this experience has left me uneasy about continuing to use this as my EDC setup, and I think I need to look for something different...
THANK YOU! Pulling by the keys while pressing with the screwdriver is the magic trick! I just took the MOCA module off and on several times easily with that method!
and YES, I have watched the video.
Not to mention, the inside of my keyport is all scratched up now from the attempts...

Well, I am back to not recommending this system... my pivot started to loosen, so I tried to remove my modules to get to the screw, and they will not come off, no matter how hard I press on the release button. My Rush tool is stuck inside the keyport too, but I've tried using a hex bit, a thumbtack, a paper clip, a mini screwdriver... no matter what I use, I can only access the release button from an angle, and it's not enough to release the modules. Now I have keys that are swinging loose in a Pivot that I can't get open. Unless you guys can come up with some way to help me out of this jam, I am going to have to look for a different keychain system and throw this whole thing in the trash...

The rush tool is too short for me to remove the light if I attached them to the neba knife or moca tool module. I have to use a longer hair pin to try to detach it. Is there any way to solve this issue?

I finally got my shipment here in Perth, Australia. The key pivot and the modules feels solid and definitely crafted well. They live up my expectation. These were made with great purpose that anyone would love. Thanks guys.
thank you
Just received mine...it's all setup and works like a charm....thanks to everyone involved from beginning till the very end....have a productive new year ahead...👍🏽👍🏽👍🏽👍🏽
O have just received my pledge (in Brazil). All looks great. I'll go on and upgraded my Slide 2.0 :^). Cheers!
Got my tool today, nice quality. Models are a lttle fiddly to change but manageable. I only regret not getting a third pocket clip

The more I carry my keyport using the Rush tool as a suspension hook, the more I like it; and the more I feel like I wouldn't have liked using the pocket clip like I had wanted to! The hook is better than a clip because it's easy to slip on and off (for my keys, the hook/clip serves only to position them for easy removal, it's not to hold them in place as the weight does a good enough job of that). I like it so much that I went ahead and installed the Rush tool inside the keyport so it folds in and out for an ultra-compact setup (even though this means I will have to use something else to remove any modules in the future)! Then by attaching my car key to the keyport's D-ring via the parapull and a mini-carabiner, I now have the smallest, sleekest, best looking, and most useful keychain setup I've ever had!
I like mine a lot but wish the moca tool and knife had locks
Got my order yesterday. Excelent product! Congrats to all of you! Thank you.

Hello, season's greetings. My items arrived today and I can safely say they are quite cool and nifty :) However, I did not receive the pivot I ordered through backerkit after the campaign closed. It is listed on the included packing slip, but not included in the actual package. I haven't seen any prior posts or updates mentioning that the pivots were to be shipped separately, so I'm guessing a factory elf was a little off in their packaging? I will send a proper email to your support service to follow upon this shortly. Other than that, I'm very happy with these tools!

Hi. So I get home after work all ready to send the afore mentioned email to your service support with pics, and what do I see? A new order placed for the pivot and already shipped! Wow, incredible. I can only thank and commend you for the speed of that. Much appreciated :)

I agree with Andy. Please do a Yubi Pivot! On another note, my wife loved this for opening Christmas presents so much this morning, she confiscated one of mine. I tried explained ownership law, but she mentioned something about marriage rights..blah, blah blah... so now I need to order another. Thanks for the great tools.
This might sound ridiculous but I backed this project primarily for the sleek Pocket Flare and the parapulls. I’m glad to report I’m very happy and impressed with their quality and utility.
Returned from a trip abroad - found my package waiting - unpacked, assembled and I am damned impressed - well done!
Maybe the suggestions could be worked out. Have a great XMas time!
Thank you Keyport for the great product! I like it!

Received mine today and I agree with other comments, the build quality is excellent. The online video does a very good job of explaining how to put the modules together and take them apart. The only issue I have is that I can not combine all the modules together, because the mid modules will only connect to one end module or one mid module and a clip. They do not appear to be able to connect end-mid-mid-end. They will connect end-mid-mid-clip or any module and clip. They carbon fiber end plate will only connect to a mid module. This means I cannot connect all of my modules (Flare, WeeLink, Neba, MOCA II) together. This is not insurmountable but it is a bit annoying. I would suggest the possibility of a connection plate that would allow mid modules to connect to end modules.
Got mine today. Thing rocks. Already used a few times today. Love it.
Got mine yesterday. They look fantastic, every bit as good as the preview at DEF CON. The Flare is definitely hitting it out of the park!
Recieved mine today on Holland, loving the feel and function. Very cleverly designed. Hell, I already want to add more pocketclips to my current build. brb checking the keyport website ;-)
Got mine yesterday, here in Germany. It's a great tool. Awesome quality.
Received today! Very well made, thanks for the QUALITY control! My only regret is not buying more than 1. Great Job!!!
I got mine a couple days ago. This thing is awesome. I'm so glad I bought two.
Thanks for a great campaign, but now I'm confused as to which way to set up all the modules. It's a good problem to have.

Mine arrive in the UK today. First impression is excellent! All the items seem very well made and have a sturdy feel to them. The hard bit now is to decide what combination to put them in. Congratulations on both an excellent campaign and delivering an equally excellent product at the end of it.
Received in London today :-)
Also, I find that the Rush tool makes a decent substitute for the unusable pocket clip, once connected to the keyport's D-ring via a split ring...
Yes, that is what I meant... I would love to have a pocket clip to put on my pivot (or slide), but the Rush tool suspension method is growing on me.
After using it a little, I can say this for the knife - it is razor sharp!
Wonder when I will get mine. Still have not receive anything in Singapore.

I got mine! A little bit of feedback after putting things together... The modules are a bit tough to take apart once they're together, especially when removing a stacked mid module, where you have to insert the pin at an angle - at one point I thought I had managed to get my tools stuck in the configuration I'd put them in! With some practice, and the rush tool, it's not too bad though. A bigger complaint is that the pocket clip cannot attach to the keyport itself, or to the side of a mid module that would face out after being attached to the keyport, so the clip is completely useless for the keyport - it's only usable when configuring the tools in a package with each other and no keyport. Since I had been carrying my keys in a Quietcarry Shorty, which has a pocket clip, this is a pretty big inconvenience for me. I had hoped to be able to clip my keyport to my pocket in a similar way. The backspring on the knife module is not very powerful, and the knife easily leaves the open position. I may end up removing the knife from my daily keyport package since this makes it of limited usefulness, and I always carry an EDC knife anyway. The MOCA module doesn't lock at all, yet to be seen how this affects the performance. The light module doesn't seem incredibly bright, but I haven't done a real test yet. The keyport itself works great of course, it's far easier to add keys and adjust tension than with my shorty. I'm still interested in upgrading to a slide later, though I'll be rethinking my module configuration based on how these work out. REALLY wish you could come up with a way to attach the clip to the keyport!
Just received my shipping info. Great job guys.

Can't wait. I am backer # 516. When is my package going to ship ? Keep up the good works guys. You are only among few good kickstarted company with integrity, good communication and follow ups. Thanks.
Woohoo got my tracking! Can’t wait!
Hi! I`m backer #816. Any news about my order? Thanks!
Just gotten my shipment confirmation. Cant wait! Thanks!
Great work! Thanks again!
Yes they have started shipping to Australia
SHIPPING to Canada ???

I think that about covers it! I'll continue working with these things and see how they fare going forward. Maybe I'll start to like the things I'm not fond of right now, and maybe I'll find a few flaws with the ones I am. We'll see!
As usual, y'all are the best!
Super easy to assemble and dissemble. Definitely a permanent addition to my pocket.

Received mine last week. Everything looks perfect except the Anywhere pocket clip is not what I expected. I misunderstood that it can attach to my Pivot. Is there anyway to attach the Anywhere clip to a Pivot? Or is there any plan for a "male" version of the clip?

@T. Ku: Unfortunately, there is no way to attach the pocket clip to a Pivot or Slide. They're strictly for holding modules and side plates. As to plans for a male version, that one I can't answer, but I definitely think there needs to be. I NEED this on my Slide 3.0!
Take a bow ladies & gents, nice product easy to assemble..congrats on the success
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/keyport/anywhere-tools-the-ultimate-modular-everyday-carry/posts/2328878
I really appreciate you looking that up for me. I know you guys are swamped. Wasn't sure what to expect when they arrive. I can't wait.

Silly me. I neglected to order a Pivot unit for my keys (my last one broke) with this campaign. I already received my modules. Is it too late for the 25% discount for the Pivot? (I’m ordering it regardless but it never hurts to ask.)
Got mine today. Thanks
I just got mine in today in AR, can't wait to test it out.
Out of curiosity, what products would be holding up the fulfillment of 'Anywhere Anytime' orders?
Have all super early bird orders shipped??
congratulations to you!
Chris...seems fishy to me. I thought this can be used as a multi tool & don’t need to attach keys to it.
No hurries on the info, as i know you have bigger fish to fry, but what mods are TSA safe? Just wondering. Thanks! Cool product and i hope you add even more mods in the future because... Why not?
I want to change the shipping address, but it is already locked down. Do I have still anyhow the possibility to change it?
Thank you!!
so if no new address and the survey has been filled out when it was first sent out, I'm golden and just have to be patient? thanks cant wait
Please pick me as a beta! I can't wait to see what you guys are doing!
Will you have prototypes available for demo at your DefCon both this week?
If you want someone in Asia to beta test, then I volunteer. :)
I would love to be a beta tester and have been for another kickstarter project. Give me a chance to help improve the product.
I'm in slc Utah semi close to Vegas I can definitely test it out for you.

campaign.story:
We have 1 simple mission - to make piano playing and music composition more fun, and more accessible to all.
↑ Overview
The Really Useful Piano Poster displays 48 separate scales, 60 individual chords and a wealth of musical theory, all in one easy-to-read poster. A great gift for Piano players and a best friend to Music Producers, the poster comes in a range of sizes, formats and colours that look great on any wall.
↑ Scales 
Never forget your scales again...or learn them if you never knew them! 4 of the most common scales (major, natural minor, melodic minor & harmonic minor) in all key signatures, including the left and right-hand fingerings. Clearly illustrated for ease of reading and memorisation.
↑ Chords
Play me an F# augmented chord. No? Me neither. 5 of the most common chords (major, minor, augmented, diminished & dominant seventh) in all key signatures, including all inversions of the chord. Clearly highlighted so you’ll never be stumped again.
↑ Theory
Diagrams and charts that help you read sheet music, write chords to a song, learn common musical notations and tempo ranges, identify relative keys, and learn the relationship between different key signatures. All handy references to help you create music.
↑ Design
The poster has been meticulously designed to make it easier to read and learn from. And we think it looks great on a wall too!
↑ Formats
The poster is available in a range of sizes, formats and colours to suit different tastes and applications. We’ve got you (and your wall) covered.
Standard – A1 Size. Printed on 170gsm gloss paper. Folded down to A4 which means it is much cheaper to ship. That's how we can offer FREE SHIPPING WORLDWIDE on this version.
Rolled - A1 Size. Printed on 250gsm gloss paper. Comes rolled in a cardboard tube. This means there are no creases in the poster, but it does cost more to ship.
Deluxe (Planned as a stretch goal) - A1 Size. Printed on 250gsm Arcoprint uncoated paper. Features silver foil debossing to logo. Comes rolled in a cardboard tube.
Special Edition (Planned as a stretch goal) - A1 Size. Printed on 270gsm Nexus Black uncoated paper. Features Spot UV and is printed in 4 different metallic inks. Comes rolled in a cardboard tube.
Classroom (Planned as a stretch goal) – A0 Size. Printed on 250gsm gloss paper. Fully laminated. Comes rolled in a cardboard tube.
↑ Funding & Rewards
Funding
We've developed the product, designed the brand, built the website and shot the video. Now, all we need is the money to fund our first print-run, so we can get The Really Useful Piano Poster off the ground and into the hands of those whom it will benefit.
Rewards
We have a simple reward structure, with something for everyone.
1. Our ‘thank you’ reward which is for anyone who wants to donate £1 or more to our campaign. The proceeds will fund the production of a special video, focusing on the technical processes involved in making our posters. The video will be shot using a Phantom Flex 4K ultra-high-speed camera, allowing us to capture ultra-slow-motion, ultra-high-definition footage of the different processes involved in all their technical glory.
2. We are offering our ‘Standard’ and ‘Rolled’ versions of the poster as rewards, with a limited amount available at early-bird pricing.
3. If we exceed our campaign goal in good time and in a manner that suggests adequate demand, we also have 3 further rewards planned, offering our ‘Deluxe’, ‘Special Edition’ and ‘Classroom’ versions.
We are aiming to ship all rewards in June 2018. The final poster may be subject to improvement changes.
Conclusion
This poster was designed out of a genuine need to bring certain learning resources together onto 1 easily-accessible format. We are really happy with the end product, and genuinely believe it will help many people learn to play and compose music far more easily. We love that thought, we love this product and we love this business. We hope you do too.
↑ Shipping
Packaging
Depending on which version of the poster you buy, it will be shipped in different packaging.
Standard – These A1 posters are folded down to A4 size (the same size as a sheet of office paper) and placed inside a plastic A4 mailing bag. This means the overall package is very small and light, therefore it is much cheaper to ship than any of the other options. That's how we can offer FREE SHIPPING WORLDWIDE on this version.
Rolled, Deluxe & Special Edition – These versions are the same size as the Standard version (A1), but they come rolled rather than folded (meaning they arrive with you crease-free). They are shipped inside an A1-sized cardboard mailing-tube, which means they are more expensive to ship than the Standard version.
Classroom – This version is twice the size of all the other versions, so it is shipped inside an A0-sized cardboard mailing-tube. This means it is the most expensive poster to ship.
Carriers & Transit Times
All Standard posters are sent via 1st Class unregistered mail, which means they do not come with tracking numbers or insurance. We do this so that there is a low-cost option for people who want to buy the poster around the world.
All other versions (Rolled, Deluxe, Special Edition & Classroom) are sent via tracked and signed services, meaning you'll receive a tracking number for your order once it has been dispatched, and you'll be required to sign for the package once it reaches you.
UK
Standard
Service: Royal Mail 1st Class
Average transit time: 1-2 working days
Rolled, Deluxe, Special Edition, Classroom
Service: Royal Mail Special Delivery (Guaranteed by 1pm)
Average transit time: 1 working day

Rolled, Deluxe, Special Edition, Classroom

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've developed the product, designed the brand, built the website and shot the video. Now, all we need is the money to fund our first print-run, so we can get The Really Useful Piano Poster off the ground and into the hands of those whom it will benefit. We’ve set a realistic funding target and we see very little risk that we will not be able to fulfil all rewards, but if there are any issues with production, our backers would be the first to know.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

support.title: Our next Video
support.descp:
We want to take a Phantom Flex 4K ultra-high-speed camera down to the printing facility in South London to film the production of our first print-run. We aim to capture ultra-slow-motion, ultra-high-definition footage of the different processes involved such as lithographic printing, debossing, folding and wrapping, then produce a short film demonstrating the end-to-end production of our posters, in all its technical glory.
As a thank-you, your name will feature in the credits of the video (unless you don’t want it to).

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
Just to keep you updated on the last couple of weeks:


I had a fantastic holiday in Morocco for a friend’s wedding.

Wow, what a month! Our campaign is finally over and we’re so pleased with what we’ve achieved. A few highlights include:
- £5,554 raised (370% of our original £1500 goal)
- 289 amazing backers
- Featured in MusicRadar magazine
When I first conceived of this poster I thought 'if I can sell 100 copies, I know I'm on to something'. Now I'm on to two somethings!!

updates.update_userinfo: Paper goes in, wet proofs come out!
updates.update_content:
We've just received these photos from the printers showing our wet proofs, which we'll receive on Monday.
Wet proofs are an important step as they allow us to check the print quality, colours and legibility of text before going ahead with the full print-run.
Needless to say, we're excited!
We’ve doubled our target and we’re twice as proud!

After just 5 days we’ve hit our target, and needless to say we’re thrilled! A massive thank you to everyone who has pledged to the campaign so far, we cannot wait to send you your posters! Now let’s see how far we can go in the next few weeks.
Have a great Sunday everyone.

updates.update_userinfo: We've just been featured on MusicRadar!
updates.update_content:
A big thanks to the folks at MusicRadar (the no.1 website for musicians) for taking the time to write about our poster. You can find the article here:
https://www.musicradar.com/news/the-really-useful-piano-poster-looks-really-useful

We’ve just reached the 10% funding mark, which is great! We’ve still got a way to go, but we have 25 days to keep driving traffic to the campaign. It’s very encouraging that people can see the value of the poster and even at this early stage it gives us confidence that we’ve developed a truly useful product. If you can help spread the word in any way then we’d really appreciate it, because eyes on our campaign turn into pledges.
Thanks for your support.
